Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Short Rib Dumplings

cawtcfVFZxlKYbxweli6rw.text: Great meal here. We tried this a few months ago. It's a little pricey but if we can splurge it's a great place to enjoy quality food and drinks! They have speciality cocktails to die for. The food was so flavorful! Great experience.

epbO7F-KIIeiEcBer9HHcg.text: Great service.  Food is delicious.  Fun atmosphere. Adding to our list of repeat restaurants.

Ph-FCa1DiKMHVlRZSUitVw.text: Everything from the atmosphere to the nightcap cocktail was fabulous. The food is interesting and delicious !!

EagCPEW9Y8Bt1-XMYQMp2A.text: Consistently fantastic. Some of the best Asian fusion outside of San Francisco. Try the pig face dumplings and the duck curry.

UdVRw2TWqRd8N3FrBs_xdw.text: Love this place. My husband and I go here often on date night. Once we sat at the bar in front of where the food is prepped and the chef started talking to us about different dishes and how they are prepared, that was so much fun.

TB8y-fPsRJJ6o__CC_KCIQ.text: The wait was a little long but the wine bar across the way was a great way to spend our waiting time. Once seated the customer service was great. The food was delicious and we enjoyed celebrating a birthday with friends here.

P85E3jN4Y00Ji1pczTkEuQ.text: My favorite restaurant in the city. Creative and delicious food, unique cocktails, and a great atmosphere and waitstaff. Never have I had even a so-so experience at this place. It is always exceptional.

D6qAIaurIg72zASWj4C8rQ.text: I want so badly to give this place 5 stars, because the food is amazing. Like, amazing. However the service is SO SLOW. We waited at least 15 minutes for vodka sodas, after waiting for them at the bar for at least 5 minutes initially, we already had finished our appetizer before our drinks even got delivered. Then when we wanted to close out, not only did I have to flag down our server, but then waited another 10 minutes for her to close the card out. To the point that we had to stand up as if we were leaving for her to bring our card back. It was so frustrating because the 3 people I brought, had never been to Clever Koi and I raved about it, only for them to be disappointed. On a positive note, the food is phenomenal and the busser and host were both very friendly and efficient.

x95CPQ8UUUS-IfmWyCE57Q.text: We are visiting from Austin, Texas and stumbled upon this place ... all I can say is OMG!!!!!   The flavors, the presentation, the vibe ... EVERYTHING about this place is uber cool and  culinarily orgasmic! We sat at the bar and watched our bar tender, Gavin, who was one of the mixologists of the drinks they serve do his thing ... he is a master of his craft and made our visit quite the experience.  One of the very BEST culinary experiences I've had EVER ...   Whenever I come to Phoenix from this day forward, this will be a "must" stop location going forward ... wow!   Going to go back to eating again ... hmmmm. I am one happy camper!   Oh, I am adding to this when one of the owners came out to check to see how everything was and surprised us with a killer dessert:  Banana fritters with Sesame ice cream and honey lavender ice cream with a side of misou caramel sauce which again was OMG!!!!   Do yourself the favor of experiencing the Clever Koi! You'll be happy you did!

uyMFS5SqkW-1J1sWgA2s6Q.text: The food here is great. The space is very cool. The clientele and staff are hip. The hostess is terribly rude, unfriendly and ruined this place for me. Treated our group poorly a few months back and I let it slide. Treated us even worse last night. I won't ever go back as long as she's employed and empowered to ruin people's night out. Thank God there exists a plethora of good restaurants to choose from. Customer service should be priority  #1. Clearly not the case at Clever Koi.

_E-MCHLwCs8igXAhNbAQxA.text: My wife and I love this place! Great veggie options and great drinks.

0DDAC-wp0y08mcbnZLkQow.text: This restaurant has a very interesting spin on Asian food. It all tastes great, but the Pho is really good! The ahi tuna nachos or whatever that dish is called is delicious!!

j0bmuii4S4VbMuF9rPUFdg.text: Excellent service, you can tell the staff work together great because no customer was unsatisfied from the food down to the waters being refilled.

yGdKzLFDvlQn2aOxLC48fw.text: Clever Koi has some of my favorite cocktails in Phoenix, and I've never had a meal here I didn't enjoy. I always get the Kimchi Fried Rice, and my boyfriend usually gets the Pork Ramen, both of which are very good. It's a little loud if you choose to sit on the patio, bit the ambiance inside is perfect, intimate enough for a date night but also good for meeting with friends. I've never had any issues with the service here, either.

r9bpMHBuGNJofGh-l7R_kw.text: The food is delicious. We had the kimchi cheeseburger, chicken sandwich and pork belly ramen. Everything was fantastic. I'd rate this a 3.5 due to the service. Painstakingly slow. Go without an agenda and lots of time.

Q8vVZwrWxfJMjClzpDOzmA.text: Their Pork Belly Ramen answered my craving for that crispy pork skin on layers of tender pork and a little pork fat. The soup stock is very flavorful and the noodles are just perfect! Their tuna chips and chicken wings are also good.  I also like the vibe in Clever Koi. I got to speak with one of the young owners. Very friendly. Highly recommending this place if you want something Asian with the LA vibe.

photos.caption: Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States

zPypMz-Wuohz0heP32BBgA.text: Clever Koi is a phoenix treasure.  The menu is an Asian fusion that is unique to Arizona.  The kitchen is open behind the counter.  Sit at the counter and watch the kitchen staff in motion with the chef orchestrating the event.  The food is very good and the menu is well thought out and unique.  The signature cocktails are on point and unique.  Decent beer selection.  A good time is always had at this spot with a great atmosphere.  I'm taking away 1 star because of the hostess, she was less than welcoming when we arrived.  She said it would be an hour wait meanwhile I could obviously see two seats at the open seating bar.  I asked if we could sit at the bar and she said there are no seats.  I replied that I could clearly see two seats and we would like to sit there.  She seemed annoyed but we were eventually sat there.  Let me say everything else about our visit was outstanding, our server was great, the staff (minus the rude hostess) was great, food and drinks were great.  A warm greeting would have made a five star visit, too bad the hostess was so rude.  One poor staff member can spoil the overall experience.

7Z1PbP1cZ4kP8NdaLoNr5w.text: Had dinner here after reading your reviews and you didn't disappoint. The place is small but spacious enough for me to maneuver around. The chairs are sturdy enough and large enough to hold my obese body comfortably during dinner. So let's get to the food!  We started with a side of wings and an order of brussels sprouts. The wings have a bite that burned long after several chugs of water and lemonade, but they were GOOD!! The sprouts are covered in a thick sauce and have chunks of meat (I believe it's sausage) that are well-seasoned and delicious.   The soft shell crab bun was surprisingly bland, but it was crispy. The pork belly bun was fried hard. I was expecting it to be tender and chewy. Regardless, it didn't stop me from wishing I had three more. Just imagine crispy, lightly salted bacon wrapped in a fluffy tortilla and you're there!  I also had the tuna chips, something I'd never heard or seen before. It was pretty good: flakes of white paper-thin crunchy things with a dollop of guacamole and several small chunks of tuna dispersed throughout. I'm glad to have experienced it, but will probably not order it again on my next visit.  The seafood XO noodles qualify as a Last Meal request, I promise you, they're that good! Mike, our server was super attentive and awesome. I'm gonna start a GoFundMe account so I can eat here every month!

Y5ykW6zz24uXU8irldnnMA.text: The quality of food was amazing. It's a small little restaurant but it was a great atmosphere. The cocktails were amazing. We got to sit next to the kitchen and it was great. If you're going on a weekend reserve a table.

W7KvoaNnGF0l9jWa9L8p4g.text: This restaurant has a beautiful ambience. Decoration, furniture layout, furniture and mood was fantastic!   I had the Pork Ramen which was really good but not worth 15$. The lunch hour specials are for Eat-In only. Our bad! We didn't know this. The egg was a bit undercooked. We were charged $0.25 for utensils and $0.50 for sriracha as the order was to go which even though it was only $0.75 was kind of a downer They didn't give us the option; it was just an automatic charge.   Service was ok. The hostess/cashier was nice but not particularly friendly but I can understand her reasoning why since, in all honesty, I made a comment about the small item charge. She didn't thank us for coming in, probably because she was on the phone, but still we would have appreciated an acknowledgement of some sort as we left.

fCthG9V33BfP-8v_zuOxiw.text: This place is really nice. I came here with my wife for a casual dinner on Wednesday night. We did not have a reservation but were lucky enough to grab two spots at the bar.   The bartenders were friendly and the drink menu was well edited. I had a whiskey cocktail which was great - I cannot remember the name but the toasted lemon juice was a thoughtful and sophisticated pop of flavor.   We ordered the sticky buns (chicken and waffle, stone crab, and cauliflower) and they were great as an appetizer. Each one of these is a perfect snack for one or you can easily knife them into two tasteful servings.   For dinner we had curry duck bowl and it was very very well done. The sauce was savory but not thick, and the spice was packing a good amount of heat without being overwhelming. If you're not a fan of spicy at all, this may not be the dish for you, but if you like a well done dose of curry heat, you really can't beat this.   I have been to this place a handful of times and have always had good experiences, however tonight's ambiance and food (and the enjoyment of my wife) led me want to commend them. Well done!  Side note - if you go for lunch their Banh Mi sand which is delicious.

4_7OV29_YI3lb6sTfrVtXQ.text: Enjoyed a lunch and dinner here! The buns are great and I'd def give them a try. I also had a noodle dish (Dan Dan) and the catfish dish. While both were delish the sauce in both was a little on the oily side for me. I would have preferred a few more "lighter" options on the menu. That being said I did go back here because I thought it was so good. And hats off to whoever picked the Riesling on the menu- it pared magically with the dishes.

rPUd2PhQiV-UgVUKtK3pkw.text: Came here since we saw some good reviews and the pictures of the food looked amazing. We were quickly disappointed by the food. It looked great but the flavor was just not what we expected. Some of our dishes were too salty. This place is also not very kid friendly. We came with our friends and we both have babies and they have a toddler. As a new mom it's important to go to places where we feel comfortable with our babies. It just doesn't seem like a welcoming place for families.

rflq9usqU5SEdgm0str2fA.text: Straight up reviewing based on drinks and their vegan options ... I've been twice to this Central location and they knock it out of the park each time.  Had the root vegetable puree appetizer that comes with scallion pancakes. A bit salty, but it is an addictive flavor and I love those pickled onions.  Had the Arizona ramen and really enjoyed the flavor and textures.  The nopales in the ramen is definitely the highlight with how they've roasted it before it goes in the soup. I've also had the Dan Dan noodle dish which comes with Impossible meat, and it might be one of my favorite dishes in Phoenix.  Super savory (again, a touch on the salty side) with those peanuts and Impossible meat.  The roasted veggies and noodles are both cooked to perfection.  Two people can easily share, and maybe even have leftovers.  Cocktails and wine that I've had here are also good. They even sampled one of the wines I was on the fence about, which I thought was nice and isn't always an option.  The bartenders and the wait staff were super friendly.  Its a clean place, with a fun vibe.  Wait times can get long so I recommend getting there a little early if you have more than 2 in your party.  Sitting at the bar is also an option.  OH! And they have daily happy hour, so take advantage of the savings on apps and drinks during that time. =)

l9gW5io3zN39deOwvcZ_WA.text: Been here a few times and this is a great little find in the Down Town Phoenix area!  The steamed buns are something worth trying I have to say.  The chicken and waffles one was my least favorite but the pork bun and the others are really good.  I was a little disappointed in the Pork Belly Ramon though.  The noodles were chewy and not very authentic tasting but the pork belly was really good.  Could have used some different textures in it but it was ok overall.  I will come back here, not a lot of other choices around it but it has great service and wonderful flavors.  KT

3DxKQK5ha32xXREyjTkhXg.text: Never had this ramen spot before but heard plenty of good reviews about it from my friends I checked it out with my friend and was not disappointed. The broth was very flavorful and the pork buns were soft, and the pork skin was extremely crispy!

photos.caption: Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Gw5KoOq1detUXhDRXhUTLg.text: PORK BELLY RAMEN = Ahhhmazing And, this is what gets the gold stars. Thankful the chef forgot to add the pork belly directly to our broth because when it was brought out on a side plate it was outstanding - perfectly cooked, melt-in-your-mouth, unctuous, salty umami. ALL. THE. THINGS. In fact, this is how we'll request it from now on.  - Riding the Pine cocktail was excellent. - The Short Rib Appetizer was delicious too.  I give this place 6 stars minus 1 for our waitress who was lacking in attention. The other staff members (and Ramen, hello!) made up for it, however.

lfkNWF9RPmq0yHedQhZW5Q.text: We go here so often I can't believe I've never reviewed it. Their menu changes regularly so we are always excited to go back and see what's next.   Get the steamed buns. I prefer the pork belly, but we always get a crab one too.   Can't go wrong with anything that has duck. The curry is amazing. And I love the wings as an appetizer (order the extra ranch).   Great specialty drinks. I prefer to sit at the bar and watch the cooks do their thing. They're so talented and I get to see all the beautiful food coming out of the kitchen.

CkJ-1Kb4ggI22u4fobukKA.text: Great app if you're looking for a memorable date night. Delivers on every level from food to drinks to service. Been here a few times with varying party sizes and there is always a great time. Ramen is tasty.

BIKpfAzpJ3qLJizCjGkwdQ.text: So happy I tried this place!! To start off with great service ! Super polite and kind employees! The waiter was so nice. Second the food is amazing!! I got the vege ramen and I NEVER fully am satisfied with ramen and I can say this is the BEST ramen I've had. I added some corn and an egg to it which made it even better. The ambience of the restaurant is also super cute and romantic. If your in town visiting like me, def worth trying !!!

photos.caption: Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States

EmdliyagfQIT3xd2IMcLhg.text: Please note I went here 6 months ago.  However, I recall having a great time and trying my first banh mi, ever.  It was so good I started making them at home.  Need to go back soon.   That is all.

JBP4gZgrV4aR-9vl_RQrEQ.text: I love their food and atmosphere. They have great happy hour, love the tuna chips, rice and duck confit!

photos.caption: Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pork belly
Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Duck confit
Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken ramen

rdbb3um_mKei5iH_cistew.text: We had steam buns, dumplings, and Dan Dan noodles. All are really good. The Dan Dan noodles that we had were really salty. Don't know if it's that salty of purpose or a fluke. But it was really salty and I drank lots of water for it. Otherwise, it was pretty good.

MxckdHGZcNY8op6OIpDaBA.text: This will come one of my favorite spots. I enjoyed every single dish here. Great customer service and fantastic food!

IcfPGUpyq7DxKBbute-r-g.text: I have been wanting to go here for as long as I can remember!! So glad I did! I loved the lemongrass swizzle cocktail! Super fresh and light. And the ramen was incredible!!! Highly recommend this place

2IjmVPfW7xPySZ8X9iZ4ow.text: Went here for Mother's Day and everything was delicious! I had the burger with kimchi on top and my daughter had a noodles dish. We both had some left over. The restaurant is stylish as well.

gIZRV3vYInSeQwRujQ7ncg.text: An Asian fusion restaurant with a modern snobby New York style interior and I mean it in a loving way. This restaurant offers an interesting spin on some classic dishes from all over Asia. Each dish is an intriguing experience as the chef mixes flavors and ingredients with little care for conventions. The Clever Koi is more akin to a Picasso than a classic masterpiece it will offer you a culinary journey with some high notes and some lower. So if you are more of a California roll and Maggie broth ramen this might not be the place for you. Give this place a chance keep an open mind and I hope just like me you can look forward to coming back to know what the menu will challenge you with.  Side note: they offer real Sake not just the horrid sweet milky nigori crap.

O1ZBf3MC4QLrrdxyeCvyXQ.text: this is a pretty cool place went in for lunch the menu seems small but it is fully custom to what you want there all bowls pick ether rice or noodles and the style that you want them pick your meat then you veggies I had two stir-fry with duck and bokechoe mushrooms the duck was grate not greasy like duck can be everything blend just right did the Ramon that was just OK I didn't like the broth to much it should if been chicken but it was really white now the goat cheese dumpling are yummy fries cheese can't beat it server was grate friendly and on top of everything defenley be back

YvvjwwzSQZC58Ibflg_Sug.text: Love the vibe. Bartenders and wait staff is super knowledgeable. Sydney was our waitress and she was definitely on point. I recommend the pot roast dumplings and the lemon pepper chicken noodle soup. The flavors were balanced and intricate, and I would certainly come here again if I lived here. Great cocktails. The ONLY pet peeve: I could taste the dish detergent on the drinks and the water (my husband couldn't). But the cocktail list was inventive and I'd love to try them all! On a side note, I liked the wall art in the bathroom.

Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Outdoor patio, looking in
Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Spicy seafood hot pot

0DnzIxuVh83PUxvdNW6Lpg.text: The patio is perfection. The chopped salad was very very very good. The steamed buns are 100% worth it. We only tried one I suggest all 3 in fact i would try all 3 and pass on the dumplings unless you have a huge appetite in which case do both but if you have to pick I'd do buns over dumplings. The ramen is very popular. It's not my cup of tea so I can't say it was to die for but the pork belly one is their most popular so we got it and it was fine but again not something I'm that in to so it tasted good but I wish we would have gotten the pad Thai with shrimp personally. Another thing I didn't get to try and wish I would have is the kimchi fried rice. Definitely will do that next time. And then their dessert menu only has 2 items there is a butter cake which wasn't worth it and then beignets which I didn't have but would try next time as well.

riE8MoED2CVknTpx1Jrl2g.text: The food here is amazing and they make some killer cocktails. Definitely recommend making a reservation.

7ljxzMxlh2iiNoPF4IP-Yg.text: A place so nice I came here twice...well three times within a week. This is the type of place you want bring your friends and loved ones to. I've come here for lunch and dinner.  It's also vegetarian friendly.   Ambience: attracts lots of different groups from business professionals to students to hipsters.   Service: very prompt, friendly, and knowledgable about the menu and drink items. I've had nothing but great service here.   Lunch: limited menu which kind of stinks but they make it pretty fast. You get to customize your own bowl a la chipotle and they have their delicious fritters available for dessert. I think the fried rice bowl is my favorite but you can do chow mein, soba, udon or ramen.   Dinner: the best time to come. Our waiter told us that he recommends everyone order something different so ppl can taste everything. We ordered the dumplings, seafood soup, crab steamed buns, cauliflower ramen, and the lemongrass chicken ramen. My personal favorites were the crab steamed buns and cauliflower ramen, but they were all delicious. The steamed buns are a HOME RUN. I can't imagine anything disappointing here.   Price: decently priced, the steamed buns are a little expensive but they're so good that $4 seems like a steal.

photos.caption: Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lunch bowl: chow mein, tofu, egg, bok choy, Palm of hearts, broccoli.

X3p_aQnEp0ya72cZcKxQ8A.text: First time trying this place with my family it was recommend to us by my daughter's boyfriend. The service is great, the staff was very attentive and knowledgeable.  I received good suggestion on the drinks and food. I tried the Aviator drink which was very good, loved it!  The location was small and modern we were seated in the patio. It was late on Saturday night and there was a cool breeze which made it comfortable eating environment.  The food was tasty, I tried the steam bun: Pork Belly, Waffles and Chicken and Soft Shell Crab. Each was original in flavor.  I also had the Shrimp and Scallop Dumplings they were delicious. My boys tried the Pork Roman noodle. They liked the noodles but were not big fans of the pork belly. Teens can't always please them. My husband and daughter had the Spicey Seafood Hot Pot. They were both pleased with the flavor and spiciness.  We shall return to try the rest of the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States. First time trying it and Ioved it.

aUafkp9nHBO0r6cVF-Qvwg.text: We have been to The Clever Koi several times.   So, this review really is overdue.  We both really like the massaman udon, tandoori chicken, edamame fritters, calamari, Peking duck, and pig face dumplings here, and the mixed drinks are yummy, too.  I really like the Negroni and Sidecar, but the boyfriend usually just sticks with a beer.  The service is really good, and the space is open, clean, and welcoming.  The prices are pretty reasonable, too.

Erfd-PbL2UjM1pr4FV58Jw.text: Despite what its name implies, at least what I thought I'd be getting, The Clever Koi in downtown Phoenix does not serve sushi. It does, however, serve really tasty Asian noodle and rice dishes, and I was pleasantly surprised to love my meal even though I usually am only a Thai and sushi fan when it comes to Asian eats.  The hip spot has a patio overlooking Central Avenue, with the "dings" of the light rail creating the soundtrack to your dining experience if you choose to sit outside - which I love doing. Inside, an open kitchen and bar complements a bustling atmosphere with tables in cozy confines that make neighboring diners your friends.  My pal and I took advantage of the $30 special, which came with a jug of spiked punch, a fruity concoction made with Japanese rice wine, pineapple juice and other fruit flavors. I could tell by my buzz it was strong, but you wouldn't be able to tell by the sweet flavor of the drink, which was refreshing and delicious.  It was the perfect way to cool off the palate during my meal of vegetable chow mein, which was very filling with a ton of noodles and veggies. I loved the house-made sriracha sauce and also added soy sauce. I cleaned up my bowl, no problem. My only disappointment was I wasn't able to take advantage of the gluten-free noodles in my dish - our server said with the veggie chow mein, that wasn't an option.  My pal got tofu fried rice, which he also enjoyed and ended up taking half of it home - his portion was also very generous, so I guess I was just hungrier. Our server said the tofu is marinated, which makes it extra flavorful, and my pal agreed.  The staff was really friendly, but it was a bummer it took about 10 minutes to get hot sauce and soy sauce after our food was delivered. Other than that, the happening spot had an energizing atmosphere and made me like Asian food more than I ever thought I would.

photos.caption: Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Interior
Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Spiked punch
Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Vegetable chow mein

sqzWjFSah09-SUjf6KaIHg.text: Absolutely amazing food!! Every dish was so delicious and beautifully presented. I recommend sharing dishes so you can get all the flavors. We shared a soft shell crab steamed bun, pig face dumplings, short rib dumplings, kimchi fried rice (I don't even like kimchi but this was fantastic), pad thai (sweet & spicy) and zesty noodles. We would have ordered more if we could eat more. The staff was very nice and knowledgeable. Fun atmosphere with large bar and open kitchen. Worth every dollar. Will definitely be coming back here.

rY7sYqeYYO0XFxNXD_Bj7A.text: Fantastic food and great service to complete another experience at The Clever Koi! Chilled green tea noodle was great and other usual offerings that never disappoint. Thank guys again!

photos.caption: Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fried dumplings with Goat cheese and golden beets. So fantastic!
Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Still addicted to the chilled green tea sobs noodles with duck
Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chilled green tea noodle bowl with duck

VE6R3iXD9BI7SgSMB1Jt3Q.text: Went here for lunch with my wife.  This place is not very big and reservations would be a good idea for dinner. We had lunch, which involves a multiple choice menu. I had the udon noodles with pork belly and pork broth, the wife had shrimp and dashi on udon.  The pork was fried but maybe a bit too much as it was getting stuck to my teeth, it was good otherwise, I would probably not have broth the next time or maybe ask for less of it, as it is difficult to eat that much food and then try to eat all the broth. The udon noodles were very well made and just the right amount of chewy.  I had their pork steamed buns which is served more like a taco, it was very good especially with their in house made sriracha.   My wife enjoyed her food but also could not finish the broth.  A lot of millennial's work here some of them can't put their phones away.  The music could have been turned down a little bit. I don't go to restaurants for music I go for food.

LJra1aOlPB6lS0MGtLBNnw.text: Clever Koi was recommended by my hotel conceirge and it was a great suggestion. I had the pork Ramen and my dinner partner had the Pork Bah Mi sandwich, both were outstanding. The Ramen has chunks of pork and pieces of pork belly and the broth was rich and tasty, it was decadent to say the least. The sandwich was good as well and comes with a fresh fruity salad that would be great on a home summer day. You can get the fries with It if that is more to your liking. The only negative with the sandwich is there wasn't enough dikan, carrots and cucumber to our liking.  I tried a draft of the Strawberry Blonde on tap and it was phenomenal, they have a wide variety of cocktails. The next time I visit I will be sure to find time to visit Clever Koi again!

YLL4xjh_xKZozRTB4SN5kw.text: Excellent food and great beverage options. Service was fantastic as well.  Their vegetarian options are off the charts.  If it's available get the cauliflower ramen.

VJ6xI3K4f-GP3FEWW2GF_g.text: This was one of those strange dining experiences.   You find a restaurant with lots of good reviews, go there with high hopes, try many things from the menu, and be surprised to find that none of the dishes are that good.   The Sriracha chicken wing was so tiny and totally lacking any kick or flavor.   Pork belly and soft shell crab buns were the most decent items in our meal, but still nothing to write home about.    The major disappointment was our main dishes.   My wife had Crispy Pineapple Duck which was so dry and hard.   I had Tamarind Mole Short Rib and I must say it was the most flavorless short rib I ever had.   Their menu looks creative and we thought our taste buds will be in for a great treat, but there was none of that....

1K5IHwxtXAs1mAub5vcSfg.text: Amazing first experience at Clever Koi.  I ended up ordering a brandy and blackberry cocktail named the Little Sheba...pretty delicious. I had the roasted corn dumplings to start and then dug into the shrimp and steak chow mein. I was stuffed but felt a review would not be complete without an amazing dessert. So I went for the bananas foster fritters.  Let's just say they didn't disappoint and I'll be starting my new diet in the morning.  As a matter of fact I may come back just for those fritters.   All in all a great new spot for me.  A little far from home but I am starting to venture out and check out new places. I highly recommend this spot and ask for David at the bar.  Great recommendations.

photos.caption: Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bananas foster fritters. Unbelievably delicious. The only thing that would have made it better wood have been a little chocolate
Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States. the little Sheba and roasted corn dumplings.

IKwm-4JtM9h3kUCGpW-TOA.text: Despite being crowded the hostess found us a table which was nice to be seated promptly on a Friday night. The service was average, there were times when we were out of water and waiting for our food, but nothing too terrible. We had a chicken and waffle dumpling as well as a pork belly dumpling and both were fair and somewhat pricy for a small portion. We had the pad Thai with chicken and it was too greasy and lacking chicken. We also had the vegetable curry with tofu which was delicious but also lacking tofu and very pricy for the portion size. Overall it was ok.

c4U9suihQ23Q2Y83JTmmpg.text: Okay so may I just say that it is hard to find weekend HH that are worth going to...  Now, I must say that on an afternoon just wandering around with not much planned or to do I just so happened to stumble onto this place. It is trendy, casual, and well decorated. The drink prices are definitely affordable and the best part is the $5 menu.  Where else can you get such a tasty little snack/lunch on a Sat afternoon? And it was not super packed so it made the exp that much nicer that I could actually hear the person talking across from me. We ordered the roasted asian beet salad and the chicken wings.  The salad was OMG amazing. For that price?? You must be kidding. Golden beets, tempura bean curd, fresh mizuna (no one has this btw), cucumber, and a lemongrass vin... so delicious for 5 bucks  And the wings, great flavor! The chili sauce was fantastic... however, i do happen to be a VERY picky wing eater. i am one of the harshest critics on wings... they were a little underdone and kinda soggy. So... note to the chef  All in all though I will be back :)

Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Duck vegetable chow mein

qpBqqKK6TrMTaHH6LqSLSA.text: The pork belly ramen was so delicious. They offer a red and green Sriracha sauce. The green sauce was so good I wanted to put it in my purse!!! (I didn't). Would return!

V9c8vGLVMpWV8HKQtYSskg.text: Came here after reading reviews on the place on yelp. The staff was really nice and the young man that serviced us pretty much the whole time we were there was really attentive. The inside of the place looked pretty cool and had a well stocked bar. We got here around lunch time so we were given a piece of paper and you basically build your own bowl. Starting with noodles or rice and then going to pick meats and vegetables. Our bowls were ok, nothing crazy spectacular but they were not lacking flavor either. The real treat were the pork belly steamed buns! They were delicious! A place I would come back to visit for some appetizers and drinks on a night when there's nothing else to do.

i7RvrXpOlw0QsELTekUHuw.text: Ive been here twice so far. I plan on going again on my birthday. The cocktails are out of this world. I dont like the taste of alcohol and the mixologists are amaaazing at creating tasty drinks.  The food is top notch as well. Open kitchen if you like to watch as well. :)

H5PpXX8hI1Fn1B6JO4R7EQ.text: I had their pork ramen and their soft shell crab buns. The ramen was pretty good. The broth was pretty amazing. It wasn't too heavy and had an amazing taste to it. The real winner for me was the soft shell crab buns I even had a bite of the other buns from my friends and they were all sooo delicious! The service was pretty good as well. Waiters were attentive and friendly. I enjoy the ambience of this place.

mEshVDG9XINl9nI1EnxZig.text: The Clever Koi serves great noodle dishes that are not as heavy as its traditional counterparts. The broth served at the Clever Koi is not the traditional Tonkotsu broth one might expect at a noodle establishment, but that is what sets The Clever Koi apart. A feature worth writing home about is the Build-Your-Own-Bowl. Here, TKC allows diners to customize his or her noodle or rice bowls. Diners can choose noodle, broth, protein, and vegetable fixings to create his or her own magical Clever-Koi-Creation. The end creation is filling but, by no means, heavy. The veggies are crisp, the broth is light, which when combined allowed me to enjoy a bowl of udon/ramen noodles without having to sacrifice 30 minutes of my afternoon to nap.   Have a hankering for asian soup noodles but want to feel a little healthy while consuming it? COME HERE.  Although I usually don't include notes on atmosphere, TKC has great scene. I would sum it up as Zen vibe with modern fixtures. I enjoy the dark metals and wood pieces. I feel like West Elm outfitted the establishment. Additionally, its worth to note that parking is located behind the building. If you are coming down Central Ave,turn into the street right before TKC and you should see a parking lot.   4 stars = I'm a fan. I refrained from giving 5 stars because the service was sub-par. Did I come at an off time? Was the girl who served my party our dishes having a bad day?? IDK, but icky vibes can really affect one's dining experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Build-Your-Own-Bowl
Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Crispy Pork Face Dumplings

BxuwqXntOQ2Qz_19XR3osA.text: We love this place! It has that small restaurant vibe and charm that a lot of chains are buying up our of phoenix which makes it such a GEM. Great food, friendly and super helpful staff that always recognize us. amazing cocktails! Awesome happy hour food prices!

bUglbZbu4xUaMmVjOnEv-Q.text: I have returned to Clever Koi several times since my initial visit and they have really stepped up their game....they no longer have 5$ ramen, but, in exchange, they have tastier food. Their calamari, hummus, and tuna chips are all awesome! Their hh burger is tasty too. They also have a number of good and reasonably priced drinks. I've been converted into a fan!

D-ldVF49-MHbT77_g5oxFw.text: Have been here Few times and cocktails and food never disappoint! Yummy cocktails and mocktail drinks made by coolest barista ! My recommendations are tuna chips" Must order", pig face dumplings ("scary name but amazing taste if you love spicy"), pork belly buns and pineapple duck rice ("delicious")! I recommend ramen and XO yakisoba noodles. My favorite spot to sit is by the bar cause I can watch barista make his crafted cocktails , it's quite an art! The only thing I did not enjoy as much is dessert. Although each plate looks esthetically pretty , bth desserts I have tasted were plain and too fried (they were not in menu but I posted a picture of one) Not my favorite. Also, quick recommendation for staff working by grill to smile a little! Definitely recommend this place for cocktails and food! Will be there soon to taste ramen!

A34ohntN6FZpXKjfM_T9GA.text: I cannot say enough about what a great experience we had at Clever Koi. We went as a big group and there was a lot of us. First, the food was amazing, everything is unique and delicious. Highly recommend the sriracha wings, and the soft shell crab steamed buns, the mushroom dumplings and the tuna chips. Amazing. The drinks were wonderful- had something called the drink formerly known as spritz, and it was awesome- strawberry aperol and sauvignon blanc, and lemon juice. Delicious.  We were one of those groups that of course paid with about five or six different credit cards, and the staff was so patient with us and accommodating. I wish I could remember our server's name, but she was wonderful, and funny, and thoughtful. They had a new menu and it is worth a trip. Nothing beats the service there. Don't miss out!

iHKXWaWvymRysi45nWZ6zg.text: We had a double date for Restaurant Week...2 of us tried the RW menu and the other 2 ordered from the standard menu. We thought this would be a good way to try multiple dishes.  PROS Pig face dumplings! Juicy, crispy on the bottom and the table was a fan of the spicy kimchi. The Kobe app - very tasty with the mushrooms, super buttery protein and cooked just right. My friend liked her forbidden rice dish, she didn't get any protein with it just veggies, she esp liked the bok choy I ordered the crispy duck, delish rice cake and pineapple puree as the sauce, veggies were just how I liked that all charred but still crunchy  CONS I ordered a glass of the Tempranillo, server came back and gave me other options.  Banana fritters were not really fritters, they were more donut holes/beignet style, it could have been cooked a little more, too gooey for me Skimped on sauces in the dishes  We enjoyed our meal and our time at Clever Koi, we look forward to trying their HH if we are in the area.

NKBynUja8j-5pQMch0lxGQ.text: I "beyond love" this place.  Amazing staff, amazing food.  I even got the food To-go from Uber Eats and it was equally fantastic which was a nice surprise.   Complaint... drinks.  I wish you just had regular Tonic and Ginger Beer sometimes. Mixology has limits.   One of my favorite spots in Phoenix for sure.

kxrBeQKuzwzqLOqH_SPX-Q.text: The food and service here is superb. I had the pork belly ramen, chicken and waffle bun, and Short rib. The ramen was a bit hard but the soup and pork belly was one of the best I ever had. Chicken and waffle was to die for!

Q0pZuAZWnoQelex4f0i5aQ.text: Love this place and love the outdoor entrance from the back parking lot! Very organic.    My husband and I both tried their pork belly ramen and their pork belly steamed bun... the steamed bun is a must try!!! You definitely won't regret it. The ramen was good and the broth was pretty great, but what I would change is removing the kimchi and changing the fried pork belly to a steamed pork belly that melts in your mouth. The kimchi just didn't belong. That would have made their ramen the best ramen I've ever had if those changes were made. I also tried their Thai basil cocktail (Thai basil, gin, lime juice and simple syrup) and it's probably the best Thai basil cocktail I've ever had.   Great and friendly service-- we'll definitely be coming back!

6QgTDHZoFDeu-Dt41NPcNA.text: A girlfriend and I stopped in here having never been and were simply delighted.   The menu is really fun, you can choose to have ramen, rice, and many other options for your base, if having soup even choose your broth, then your protein, and lastly your veggies.   I ordered a ramen bowl, pork broth, duck, and a couple veggies. My friend had a ramen bowl as well with steak and veggies. She also ordered the chicken and waffle app which was small for the price, one piece, but she enjoyed it.  Overall the food was amazing, the duck was dark meat, broth was full of flavor, and the bowl was huge however the price is a bit much for what your getting and it took 30 min or so to receive our entree however I was informed everything is made fresh including the meats so that may be part of it.

BQeiiGAb33xgpj2Za7RyVg.text: Tommy bar tender and the whole staff is very nice and fast. I ordered chopsuey was excellent.  Will come back.

nBkQkzdcssrfyOD__qH1Yg.text: Great food and cool atmosphere. Would recommend. Still haven't tried the ramen dishes. On our list.

xLV4vhOClhCXpltET8zpBg.text: Not an authentic Ramen, but I like what they have done with the food. Wonderful ambiance and great service and awesome bartenders.

j6qDqC23v3-BV03J_Hh2pQ.text: If I could take anything with me for the rest of my life, and always have it in my purse, in my fridge, in my food, it's the Panang brown butter. You're doing yourself a disservice by not ordering the whole deep fried soft shell crab.  This place incredible and doesn't even need my review. We had the Softshell Crab, Short Rib Dumplings, Kimchi Fried Rice with duck, and Pork Belly Ramen. All exceeded our expectations. Cutting into the crab and having it just ooze bright white, juicy meat was so satisfying. It had the beautiful taste of the sea that told you how fresh it was.   Everything was great. We were lucky enough to sit at the bar looking into the kitchen, our own personal chef's table. The cook working the fry station was super nice and engaged with us. My favorite restaurant in Phoenix.

8K7PGdr3IN68SiVc5kpyqg.text: It occurred to me today that I have never written a review of this place and I've been coming here semi-regularly for the last two years! Let me just say, if I could give the Clever Koi a hug, I would but my arms just aren't long enough. As an Asian American, the term "Asian fusion" tends to give me pause. But the guys who run this place know what they are doing. The food is almost always excellent or near excellent. I feel Clever Koi deserves five stars because they add new menu items with the seasons. The penchant for experimentation shows a restaurant that doesn't rest on its laurels.  Of their permanent items, I like their version of "chips and guacamole" which is shrimp chips, tuna and avocado with a bit of wasabi. Their baos are also tasty, especially the soft shell crab and chicken. They are close to authentic bao. As for seasonal items, tonight I had a persimmon beet tart in a matcha puff pastry that was just out of this world. I also had black vinegar ribs that were pretty tender. For the level of creativity and sophistication, I think their prices are absolutely fair. I'm sure if they were in Chicago or New York, everything would be a lot more expensive.   The icing on the cake is the hospitality. I like to bring my friend's dog to their dog-friendly patio. Then the dog got sick and was really wobbly when we went. We weren't sure if she was going to recover. One of the owners felt so bad, that he had a saucer of chicken brought out for her. And these weren't chicken scraps but nicely chopped pieces that had been cooked in lemongrass. Penny did recover and the co-owner has never forgotten about her and still occasionally brings her some chicken. ;)   This is the kind of place that I would take out of town guests to. The delicious food and the modern atmosphere make this place on par with any restaurant in NY or LA. I'm such a loyal customer now that they could accidentally set my clothes on fire and I would write it off as just an off day. Not that they would ever do that!

photos.caption: Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Clever Koi has a dog-friendly patio. That is the manager tending to Penny. :)
Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Clever Koi is dog-friendly as demonstrated by Penny making her way toward the patio.

Z_U95Oz8kDPel73aAAIayg.text: Any dish with grilled steak or pork belly is special.  They wood fire grill the meat were you can see it behind the bar.  Gone with co-workers, kids, lunch, dinner... feels to me both modern and comfortable.

WbxYVI8qvwSn1j1BuPEOzg.text: The food here is exceptional!  We came for happy hour and ordered lots to share.  The black bean pancakes were amazing (like a vegetarian crab cake), the burger and fries were one of the best around.  The chop salad dressing was spectacular, and the pad Thai had perfect flavor, and the Szechuan catfish was perfectly rich and spicy.  We were incredibly impressed with every flavor we tasted!

TTdMiqbVc6BfwVOc_YD7QQ.text: It's ok.  Just ok.  The atmosphere?  Ok.  The food?  Ok.  Nothing special, but okay.

yuhuAfEkT4n40Vxcx6KRIQ.text: The Clever Koi is a great go-to for an instant ramen fix. I ordered the chicken & waffle bun as a starter, which was incredibly unique and absolutely delicious. When it comes to the ramen, the pork ramen was good but didn't taste incredibly authentic or flavorful, which is why The Clever Koi isn't necessarily a 5 star restaurant in my book. However, the kitchen does a good job of giving the dishes their own spin, and I would definitely go back next time I'm in the mood for ramen.

esOtsykzh0Jup5feNnZt4g.text: Love the Clever Koi! Food and flavor are great, and the atmosphere always sets a nice tone for your meal. Their steamed jackfruit dumplings are insane. I could eat them as a meal on their own! Also recommend their craft cocktails. They have some unique ones as well as your classics.

alM1Kvj4GYPcX0zyoPDamQ.text: Had dinner with friends on a Saturday night.  Crowded but we got a table in 15 minutes.  Nice decor, nice table settings, drinks were good, service was OK for a busy night.   We samples 4 or 5 dishes.  All were tasty, well prepared, and there was attention to detail in the kitchen.  Things tasted good and looked good.  Enjoyable.  Would definitely go back. Recommended.

18Hoh9zXnGoSKc5FrkTgYA.text: Wow - what a mind blowing experience. Duck fat chicken wings. Fresh crab steamed buns. Attentive server who made sure we were fully present to attend to their happy hour specials. High quality old fashioned accompanied our Asian fusion indulgences. Tasty meal.

VF4ubr-eNfcKeEW84ZAWBg.text: Very good selection of food.  We tried the Toast appetizer which is wood grilled sourdough with tofu ricotta,  Japanese eggplant,  heirloom tomatoes with a smoked soy gastrique.  The only thing was I didn't care for the gastrique.  It left an odd taste in my mouth.   The pig face Kimchi dumplings were awesome. Melt in your mouth.   Also tried the Chow Mein with duck. It was a step up from other Chow Mein that I've had.   Also ordered a Manhattan which was made well.  Nice smooth drink.  Still gave it 5 stars for the service and ambiance. But be warned, the prices are a little high.

2ZLT6hQhbPcaBNsQauIvwQ.text: This was second visit and they did not disappoint me. I had the pork belly fried brown rice with mushrooms, bok choy, and soft boiled egg, amazing. Very nice to see Andrew again and our menu advisor she was awesome (forgive me I didn't get her name). I'm sure to be back soon.

S94RV_5HkpXxAc0J_Y4a1A.text: The Clever Koi is located in a beautiful space and serves up some of the best Asian-inspired food I've had in the valley. It's pricey, but totally worth it! They also don't skimp on portions so you do get your money's worth.

1TVEvjIf1TYlaq64ddHI7Q.text: Excellent food and service. The Paloma my girlfriend got was tasty and my IPA went well with my burger and my duck curry. There were a few small issues but it was quickly handled by Nick the owner, it's important to focus on how issues are handled than the issues themselves (because they will always pop up). RaeAnn was very nice and had great recommendations. Overall I'd say it was worth the $80.00 and I will continue being a regular. Best old fashion in town btw!

bk9QMZQ3XTYWx7gMzgtcsw.text: This place has some very unique flavor combinations for Asian fusion. There was hints of Asian flavors that reminded me of home but also some new aromas that complimented the food really well. Many of the dishes are spicy, which I didn't realized until after we got it to our table. So if your sensitive to spice then you may want to check with you waiter. In order to get a tasting of different dishes we ordered several plates and shared them all. We started off with a tempura catfish steamed bun, very light in flavor but had a very good sauce. We then tried the rabbit gyoza and pig face dumplings. The rabbit gyoza was greasy but the pickled carrots were a really good compliment with them - making them taste fantastic. The pig face dumplings were very good, it had some of their house made red siracha which made them a little spicy. We also tried the wok fried brussel sprouts, which were interesting because the first few bites reminded me of an Asian wok fried vegetable but them the peppery smoky aftertaste makes me forget I'm having brussel sprouts. We also had the duck curry, which for our taste was too spicy and we weren't able to get past bite number two. It started out very delicious but the heat from the spice was too much and numbing that I couldn't taste anything after.   Lastly, we tried a cranberry cake with sesame basil ice cream, which delicious. The basil and sesame were very light and complimented the warm sweet cake. Overall, everything was tasty but wished we would've know which dishes were spicy and which were not.

photos.caption: Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Duck Curry packed with lots of heat
Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cranberry cake with basil sesame ice cream

Dy8We_5HK-oWlgt027_i6g.text: I loved my dinner here.  I ate the Korean fried rice, and my dinner mate had ramen.  We both enjoyed ourselves, the service was fantastic, and the food lived up to the hype. I would definitely go back and try the ramen, as well as more of the appetizers.

LD0KlAbpcdQwNGiM3u0Tew.text: Coming from a woman to loves Asian fusion and ramen, I thoroughly enjoyed this spot. Only problem was the service which was VERY slow! Read my pro and con list for more info:   Pros: -The Asian-fusion food is delicious and healthy for the most part. I got vegetarian ramen noodles with tofu, which I loved and would order again!  -Very modern and trendy atmosphere -Wonderful feng shui - the light, decorations, and greenery uplift me  -Convenient parking   -Reasonable prices   Cons: -Service was slow and unapproachable   -Food took very long -Very busy during lunch -- was hard to get a table, be served, and get our food

photos.caption: Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States. DELICIOUS ramen soup! All vegetarian.

yjsq9s-ERX7i6DJVFUFiNA.text: I'm a little torn on this place.  My fiancee really enjoyed it, but to me it was ok.  I am a little bias cause I do come from a Asian family and we owned a family restaurant, so this Asian fusion is a little confusing to me.  The place had a nice environment and "trendy" but it's still all about the food.  I thought for the prices of the food, they sure do give very small portions.  If I told my parent's I paid over 14.00 for ramen, they would probably slap me!  I much rather have a big bowl of Pho that costs me 8 bucks, than the ramen that I had at Clever Koi. I ordered the Pork Ramen, which had two peices of pork belly, an egg, and some veggies, with very little ramen. The good thing is most of the food was flavorful and delicious, but just very small portions.   The service was good, we sat in the patio, cause inside seating was over 45 minutes long!  So we sat outside with another couple.  We split couple of appetizzers and buns, and each order a ramen dish.  With couple of drinks, the bill came out to over 120.00.  The sad part is when we left, I told my lady I am still hungry, not just a little but a lot.  I felt I could eat another meal, so on the way home we stopped and picked up a Sonoran Dog and called it a night.  Overall, this place was pretty good and had flavorful food, but for those prices, I rather go somewhere else.

Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pork ramen
Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 3 buns

0vuCE8UFipvRLHzCGdYwYQ.text: Good but not good enough for us to want to return. My husband and I had been scouring yelp to find an amazing restaurant for our anniversary and stumbled upon this place due to the reviews. Located in a really cool building with lots of rustic wood and glass displaying the kitchen and dining area. I loved the "sushi bar-esque" seating in front of the kitchen where you could literally watch them making your food. I had such high hopes upon reading rave reviews and arriving at this place but the food and service did not back up the aesthetics.  We were told to wait upon arrival because they needed to "reorganize", even though there were plenty of open tables. We waited about 10 minutes to be seated without being offered a menu or drinks. When another couple came in and was immediately seated I asked why we were skipped and she said they had a reservation and she was just about to seat us anyways, coincidentally. Would be nice if their website advertised/allotted reservations so I could have done the same. Not one time while we were waiting though did I see any "reorganizing", or moving of tables in the dining room.  Upon being seated we were handed menus and I have to say there was a great variety of dishes on the menu that you don't see often. Pig face dumplings and steamed bun assortments.  That was exciting. I ordered the Tofu soft bun and my husband ordered the Softshell Crab and the Pork Belly buns. As we went to pick our buns up from their holders, the outsides of the buns were stuck! Most of it was torn and stuck to the holders which was disappointing. Maybe lightly oiling the holders or having non stick holders in the future would prevent losing some of your bun. Overall good flavor and definitely the highlight of the whole meal. I would almost suggest ordering a variety of those as your meal, asian taco style.  Main entrees consisted of the Roasted corn Ramen for myself and the Seafood Hot Pot for my husband along with plenty of their handcrafted cocktails. 2 bartenders for the whole restaurant was probably not the best idea. We waited a long time for drinks, 15 minutes or more sometimes and thats only because we had to flag down our waitress whom looked a bit lost. It was confusing as well because almost every item was brought by a different waiter/waitress which made it hard to connect with our own server.  Roasted Corn Ramen was rich and creamy with great extraction of corn flavor.Just wish they had either allowed me to add the tempura corn on my own or left it to be plated on top last minute because it was really mushy in the ramen once it reached me and lost all of its crispy crunch.  Seafood Hot Pot was lacking in seafood. You can't call something seafood and only put out 2 types of seafood. They should call it shrimp and octopus ramen. Thats what it was. Flavor was there though and the homemade srirachas were a great touch.   All in all it was good, not great, no hard feelings but they should focus more on the basics than what will look cool and different.

photos.caption: Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Summer Corn Ramen-delicious but tempura was soggy:(
Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Donny wang fizz cocktail (overly sweet)
Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States. seafood hot pot (lacking in seafood..)

nkyg1G_N_HGrTvescHcfxA.text: Clever Koi brings you modern Asian fusion dishes meets west coast vibes all mixed into one. Clever right? Parking lot area  is small but they do offer free valet which you can tip via cash or with the bravo app for your the one who doesn't carry dollar bills on you! Right when you walk into the hallways, you'll notice other small/ big restaurants check those out if you're waiting for a table it can get busy but I went and I didn't wait that long so everything all worked out. Inside is so, very eye pleasing lots of complimentary colors bar is close to the wok action/kitchen smaller than I expected but seating was all arranged nicely. Let's talk about the food, it was happy hour read some reviews known for their cocktails I liked how they have a special well gin and tonic which is my favorite very refreshing get it if you like gin! Got the Spicy tuna chips well played and tasted even delicious I also ordered the vegetable kimchi fried rice with tofu! Awesome everything was to a T! Service was wonderful the GM/ Owner was on grounds making sure everything was right and even asked us how our food was, which is awesome the hostess then became waiter was cool! Definitely a cool hip trendy and growing restaurant awesome people! Arizona check it out if your in uptown or close to downtown! Stay hungry tho and be cool!

qdi_YQpHQ_5OarAwOa3dMg.text: I've ordered twice now from Clever Koi through UberEats and both times have left me underwhelmed. Every once in awhile I crave broth based soups. When I want Ramen I generally go to Umami in Tempe but if I'm working at my desk I can't always drive over there. So I tried Clever Koi.  My first round with CK was pork based broth and ramen noodles. It was OK, not amazing, the broth had a unique flavor and the order of Sriracha I got with it, helped pump up the flavor.  The second round I ordered Dashi broth and udon noodles with mushrooms, snow peas and shrimp. The shrimp and mushrooms tasted off. Like the mushrooms were canned and the shrimp should've been served yesterday. Everything was incredibly bland, it lacked in any seasoning and I had to add salt to the entire dish to even get anything to pop. This time I didn't order Sriracha and I really should have. I had a small packet of Cholula in my desk and added that to the soup and it helped. I had a co-worker order a rice bowl with the lemongrass chicken and she said it was "two thumbs up." So maybe if you're looking for a rice bowl hit up Clever Koi, but I've officially called off the soup orders from them.

jzpaxEJj3fjEuKOSZT9GTg.text: Fab lunch here this week. Started with the chicken & Waffle (steamed bun style/taco) hot, fresh right off the stove. Also I sampled the pork belly bun--YUM   Lunch was a bowl of ramen $5 then you add your add-ins egg, pork belly, Bok Choy w/many other options as well.   Overall everything from the service to the food was very good. I want to try some cocktails one evening in the near future.

photos.caption: Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Make your own ramen
Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken &amp; Waffle taco? And pork belly bun

Xei_OKLm4uL1XLa9n3nGxA.text: There is never a bad thing at Clever Koi or a bad time to go. I love the Build Your Own Ramen Bowl Lunch. It's pretty traditional with some flavorful twists like using duck. They make their own Kimchi. Get the chicken and waffle bun or the spam bun...or both. Their cocktail program is surprisingly creative and on par with any in the valley.

l_BI4P9ebxY5PZ5Diqxm9Q.text: Great outdoor seating area, with some road noise, with a modern Asian flair interior. Fantastic choices on the menu and the only place I've found in Phoenix offering fresh steamed bao! Food was very tasty and artfully presented. My guest had a slight mishap with her main dish, but the friendly waitress immediately resolved it and presented a new, fresh dish. If it weren't for this minor bump in the road, Clever Koi would get 5 Stars from me!

YxIuqm1DDnJumCTlXPvZ8g.text: Never disappoints! The kimchi is on point. Excellent and consistent. Great service. The Pig Face dumplings are so good.

Dfn8zktxlOagNZ33Djl0-w.text: Please bring back the create your own ramen, on the lunch menu.  It was THE reason that my coworkers and I often came in for lunch (and to watch soccer), but no longer.  If you attempt to customize your ramen, it ends up being $15 since it "isn't on the menu".  That is a tad absurd when I still cannot order exactly what I want.

7vOTWr5yUWPX9XZpGdeRkQ.text: Nice cute place to hang out on a hot summer day. I absolutely love their outdoor space which is well shaded with greenery and misting fans.   I appreciate the enthusiasm of the chefs who are trying their hands at being innovative with their cuisine. There is definitely a wide variety on their menu and I am sure everyone should find something that will satisfy their palette.  We started with a drink which decent but nothing memorable there, esp. since despite our request to add one large cube of ice the bartender just added a lot of small cubes which diluted the drink in minutes before the server could help.   My top fav dishes here were the tuna chips a must try. I loved the crunchy thin rice crisps and the fresh crudo tuna, the wasabi guacamole was a nice finishing touch. The trick is to eat this quickly as the rice paper chips tend to get soggy by the end. The second dish that came close to this was the soft shell crab steamed bun very delectable indeed.    Why the three star review then ... this truly is a 3.5 star place the .5 for our server who was helpful and gave some nice recommendations. The food though disappointed after the dishes mentioned above, the chicken n waffle was the prime reason for the lower rating my husband loved chicken and absolutely never complains about it unless it's really bad, he simply hated the crispy chicken thigh so u tried it it was definitely overdone. Dry and chewy. The second dish that completely disappointed was the roasted mushroom dumplings ... the filling had no flavors whatsoever and they were also over cooked, I am not sure if this was the only time good was over cooked or it was supposed to be like this as the place wasn't too crowded when we were here.   The spicy seafood hot pot was ok but I love ramen ... like really love ramen and any kind of noodle soups. This one just didn't hit the mark, the broth was interesting but slightly heavy on the gochujang which masked other subtle flavors if an  Tip: Bonus they have a daily happy hour menu till 6pm.

xMsM9OQ0UNqgWnRlIM-WNQ.text: I wish... I loved this place more than I do. It was one of the first places when moving to Phoenix I wanted to try and was honestly just left feeling a little disappointed.  For dinner I had the steam bun with crab, short rib appetizer, and the pork belly ramen bowl. So for me I love short ribs and pork belly, and I just wasn't impressed with either. The short ribs were a little too sweet for me, they tasted really sugary (which I'm sure some people love but not necessarily my thing). They were super thin slices and a little pricey for the portion. The steam but was free with yelp check-in, my friend liked it a lot. I had a little taste and the flavor was really good there.  The pork belly was okay but didn't wow me by any means, but mainly I just didn't love the flavor of the ramen broth. I ate the pork belly and a few noodles and just left the rest.  Overall, it's a super cute ambiance. I love the outdoor seating... but the food didn't necessarily leave me wanting to come back a second time.

-M-dvJJzOfivJ9E7tFolCQ.text: This is one of the best joints in central Phoenix for vegetarians (lots of non-veg options, too) and Asian fusion food. The dishes are unique, though the classics, like their chow mein, are delicious, too.

LRnmabr8DIHj3NygX9DThw.text: The only thing clever was making the food look good...taste was just not there.  Food: PORK RAMEN- it had carnitas in the ramen...and it was very out of place. It was very interesting. Sadly, I would not order again.  BANANA FRITTERS- I thought it would be more of a warm soft creamy banana inside....but looked and tasted more spongy than anything. The caramel sauce it came with was watered down and out of place...too much sugar overall. Since the fritters are covered in sugar already.  CRISPY PINEAPPLE DUCK- it was really dry, hard to chew. It was overcooked for sure. I wouldn't order again. SOFT SHELL CRAB STEAM BUN- very sour, because of the sauce that's in it. If it was just the soft shell crab, it wouldve been great.  GALBI SHORT RIB- I wish it were more moist with sauce. It was tough, I felt like it was overcooked.   Service: Superb! There was a waiter specifically to refill your water glass, and clean your table. Very nice gentlemen, quick and on point with service!   Atmosphere: Romantic and Instagram trendy, love it!

photos.caption: Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Banana fritters
Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Crispy pineapple duck
Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pork ramen

SvTmysK_5GfMOewW16miuQ.text: Food is way too salty. We tried the pork ramen and duck curry with brown rice. Good they didn't charge for brown rice. In the ramen, the fried pork tastes good but got too salty half way through the rest of the ramen. As for the duck curry, there were so little duck, it was not worth the price. Great ambience though. Service was fine.

YIBCspptMW0FICQZ0XmfPg.text: Located on Centra Avenue, this place has a chill ambience especially during nighttime. Came here on a weekday for a dinner and it was somewhat packed. Reservations are available so if you're looking to get seating for a bigger group keep in mind there's that option to book beforehand.   They had free bun check in when I went - not sure how long this promotion will last. Everyone at the table ordered different buns but were all satisfied by them. I personally tried the soft shell crab one and I enjoyed it. One thing to note if you're allergic to shellfish of any sort they fry the pork belly in the same oil. The servers were pretty attentive to this since we had someone at the table who was allergic. They ended up giving us more buns than ordered!  I got the pork belly ramen. I wasn't all that impressed - the broth wasn't flavorful. For 15$ it came with soft boil egg, bean sprouts, pork belly, nori, and green onions. Portion size was reasonable, but more flavoring would be preferred. Coworker got the shaken beef - apparently that's where it's at.  While the poor waitress were running around to make sure we were still okay due to the shellfish fiasco. She ended up giving us dessert for free. Very good service so that's always a plus.

photos.caption: Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States

EDwv0Oq2tA5UPfPTzQhYUg.text: The decor of this restaurant is very hip and sleek. I love the chairs they use at their tables. I appreciate that their happy hour is 11am-6 pm and they have drink and food specials for their HH.   On my visit I tried the XO noodles, which was yakisoba noodles with shrimp and scallops. I enjoyed the dish, however to me the sauce tasted a little too salty.  Our server was very friendly and continued to refill our drinks even though we stayed almost 2 hours during lunch.

SNiBSbUYG30cR6wBAYJrvg.text: On my last night in Arizona, three of my friends and I decided to check out a local ramen place. Two of my friends are locals, and they have a spot they typically go to, however the drive was a bit further from the airport - I was catching a flight fairly soon.  I did some searching and found this ramen joint called "The Clever Koi".  The restaurant's interior was all glass, the store front came with a patio, surrounded by plants and was dimly lit lighting which made the area cozy. There were low hanging light fixtures that added a rustic charm to the inside. The table was intimately set with a candle and some cutlery wrapped in table napkins - not typically of a ramen restaurant.  They have a minimal menu, not much food to choose from which I found kind of delightful as having way too much food options can be overwhelming. They also have a Vegan friendly section to the menu which one of my friends opted for, Vegan Pad Thai.  We started off with the Calamari Fries for our table. The calamari had a crispy exterior and tender inside, seasoned well and is complimented by the dipping sauce, all in all an appetizer that would make you go "DDDAAAAAMMMNNN!" After your first bite.  FUN FACT:  When you check in on Yelp you get a free steamed bun! I ordered the Pork Belly. The pork was crisp and the fat to meat ratio was perfect for the size of the bun. It was seasoned well. The sauce and bun were absolutely delicious.  Now on to the Main:  Three of us all ordered the Pork Ramen.  When the food arrived, I immediately noticed the well presented dishes, considering it was a bowl of soup and noodles. The first tried the broth, it tasted clean and beefy, and the kimchi added a bit of a vinegary taste and spice to the dish - this did not taste like your traditional ramen. However the flavour profile was orgasmic in my opinion. The ramen noodles was tender and cooked to perfection. The crispy pork belly and the carnitas in my ramen was so flavorful my mouth is salivating as I type this. It also had an egg which balanced out all the flavours.   Definitely a gem in my opinion. Again it may not be traditional but the fusion of this dish was certainly well crafted. A great way to end my last day of my vacation, oh yeah I forgot to mention our server was awesome - I did not get a chance to get her name but she was bad ass ;)  PS try the Sake if you wanna get a little tipsy while having your dinner :)

2ALEEqh13xW5YaoJtBF_hA.text: Drinks were perfect! Couldn't find a single thing to perfect on any of the cocktails we tried. The food however was a 4/5. Pass on chicken and waffle bun - the waffle was way too soggy and pass on the root vegetable dip - scallion pancake is doughy and dip is bland. The cauliflower bun good but slightly bland. Dumplings were great and a perfect appetizer to start with. Dan dan noodles also a 5/5.

y-BS65-D4QioR_HGsE897Q.text: Had a lunch team meeting here on a Thursday. No problem at all for parking or getting a table for six. We had an assortment of appetizers including confit wings, vegan spring rolls and a cauliflower dip. Our favorites were the wings and the spring rolls. The wings had a great flavor and some heat. The spring rolls were very good. The kiwi added a unique flavor. The peanut sauce was exceptional.  Lunch choices ranged from Pad Thai, burger and fries, a Banh Mi Sandwich with carnitas  and Pig Face Dumplings. The flavors were great and fresh. French press coffee after lunch and some folks shared almond cookies and cheese cake.  Nice ambience with a cozy setting. Service was good. If you are in a hurry or have a short lunch break,  may want to consider ordering ahead or take out.

ggYi1lxmnZg7K9750qzlOA.text: This restaurant was delicious.  We went on a Saturday night around 8 and there was an 1 1/2 hour wait. We left. C8UOJ7mnb43UFsHUn2ZVcw.text: Happy hour here is amazing!! Such great atmosphere even the aroma of the open fire grill makes your mouth water! Had the pork ramen and banh mi sandwich soo delicious!!

acawRb2KTvnGUVIqIxD4dg.text: Would categorize this location as hip(ster) and cool. There was a wait, so call ahead. A place to meet up with friends or a date. Really nice and attentive staff. Steam buns are the best. Went specifically for the Ramen and it was ok. Good presentation. Stick with the steam buns (pork) or other type of noodles.

photos.caption: Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States. There&#39;s a wait, but it&#39;s worth it!

qqWvYsd6qjiK6NE-FedZ2g.text: Every great restaurant deserves a great review; especially if you're here every other week. It would be more often if I didn't feel so weird about being their all the time.   Let me start with the staff - they freaking rock. Every single person is absolutely amazing. Cool vibes. You have a server, but all too frequently you'll see that everyone's helping everyone out.   The ambiance? Perfection. I love how the restaurant isn't too big. It's always hustling and bustling. You can sit on the cute green patio, the dining area, or at either of the bars - one by the bar or the one in front of the kitchen. Both are stellar.   The drinks? Can I just say ? They're beautiful. ALWAYS perfect. Extremely unique and tasty. I always order the Moscow Mule. You're probably thinking that's easy you can't mess that up, but trust me you can. Not only are they not messing it up, but it's actually the best Mule I've ever had.   Last but not least, the food. Where the begin? We've probably tried almost everything on the menu, but I order the same thing everytime because I'm obsessed. I live for the tuna chips. You have to try it!!!!!!! Always get the pork belly and soft shell crab steamed buns. Yummmm! Not kidding. Short rib dumplings...say no more. Oh and I guess it's entree time, which at this point I'm pretty full, however I order anyways. My go-to is the kimchi fried rice with pork belly and EXTRA pork belly. Try it you will not be disappointed.   You're welcome, but please let me know when you're going because I'd rather not have to wait too long

5qusx4NZ3AMdgNxxCTsV-A.text: I had my car serviced next door and thought I would kill some time by checking out the business next or the it. Waitress did what she needed to do basically didn't go out of her way to explain things on the menu. Served sodas out of cans seemed cheap. Food was okay, probably won't go back or refer this place.

S6v354F0EJ9DJoBBmU6VzA.text: I was so impressed with this take on Asian fusion. Stumbled upon happy hour here and had the XO noodles recommended by the waitress, which had excellent flavor though were decently spicy. Also had the pork belly steam bun, which might be one of the best things I've eaten EVER - crispy caramelized meat on the outside though incredibly juicy on the inside. Wait staff was attentive and polite and there's a fairly large parking lot in the back adjacent to the George and Dragon. Can't wait to come back!

DiBDoEtXKMfuGyc1Gzqkng.text: Hipster nightmare.. Salty and marginal. Service is slow  and the signature ramen dish was the worst thing I ordered... Couldn't even finish it

b8HIDs2iuFNVmOoRexohpw.text: Great food, good service, nice clean fun place. I just had a couple soft crab rolls and loved them!

SrX7Ynqf6hRyesf0O4gKlw.text: Inventive menu w fresh ingredients  Delicious specialty cocktails Relaxed but focused ambiance (great music)

BwAYmzA1zTcTTtcf3VPE4A.text: Clever Koi is Americanized-Asian fusion food with a super cute ambiance. We were seated on the outdoor patio on a particularly beautiful night, and the twinkly lights and abundance of plants around the patio made it very inviting and comfortable. We got the shumai dumpling appetizer, at the urging of the waiter, and it was ok. I dont' think it was hype-worthy... it definitely tasted like frozen dumplings that were heated up and doused in sauce. Not bad, but nothing authentic... although, I guess people don't come to Clever Koi expecting super authentic Asian food. The shaking beef appetizer was really enjoyable, with large chunks of tender beef and bright, acidic tomato and arugula with yuzu vinaigrette to balance out the meat and rice. We also tried out the XO noodles, which were a tad bit spicy and kind of just tasted like your average yakisoba noodles. Nothing to write home about. Overall, while I didn't find the Asian fusion food particularly spectacular, I think Clever Koi is really cute inside, and would be a nice spot to come for a date or for a drink with friends.

3HMptyzju90-GozgXs6v1Q.text: Great spot. Get the Pork Belly Baos, Seafood XO noodles and the confit wings. Excellent craft cocktail game with plenty of craft spirits.

beF2quRmlBLbh9HUq8_AKg.text: I have been here several times before but haven't posted a review. I came in on a Thursday for happy hour. There are some pretty decent deals on the menu.  The food is always great my favorites are the tuna chips, wings and the ramen. I also love that they have Dragoon IPA on tap. The service is always good but the last time we came in Michael was our server and he was awesome! Friendly and funny. Making the service even more spectacular was his assistant Jason. He was on top of it the entire meal. I accidentally forgot my to go box and Jason ran it out to me. That is going above and beyond and I really appreciate that. On a side note, I'm really happy they have a bike rack out front now.

T9vDnYzGXJNH9Ukgxzbqeg.text: The ambiance was great. I love the design of the restaurant. We didn't have to wait long for seating; as soon as we entered we were able to get a table, however, it took about 10 minutes for a waiter to take our order. I thought the food was alright.

4TDw7gyMwbp0w41G_69isg.text: Cozy spot in Cenpho! They redecorated- looks more spacious and fresh! Great customer service! Delicious drinks and great choices- beer, wine  & cocktails! Food was still just alright- nothing out of the unordinary. I always get something that is over-cooked, thus dry. Somewhat loud inside. Very easy to pass right by it, so be aware!
