4_1bk97qy0ySBaln5T4sJw.text: First walking into the restaurant, the atmosphere was very modern as well as a bit rustic in appearance. A great vibe as we were seated by the window. The menu was simple and had a variety of things to eat and try. We started off with an amazing tuna chips appetizer as well as three steamed buns: the soft shelled crab, pork belly and the chicken and waffle one. All the steamed buns were delicious and flavourful but I personally liked the pork belly steamed bun which was sweet because the hoisin sauce while my girlfriend's favourite was the soft shelled crab, it was a bit tangy and it paired super well with the crab itself. The customer service was pretty great as well, our waitress was attentive and friendly.  The Pork Ramen was pretty average, but i appreciated the thick and chewy noodles.  The Shaking Beef was okay but nothing special  TLDR; apps were great, main dishes were alright and place looked nice

9cEoG4pmxppKJDhDCr_GKA.text: Clever Koi is the type of restaurant I like to be careful about. Establishments that sacrifice things like sequence of service, quality of food, or efficiency of space. I'm disappointed with Clever Koi because it seems like they brush dangerously close to all three of these sacrifices in order to maintain a trendy atmosphere.   1. I arrived to Clever Koi at around 7:45. The parking lot was packed and we were lucky to grab a spot as someone was leaving. Upon entering the establishment, it was clear that they were approaching capacity because every table was taken and the wait for 2 was 45 minutes. Luckily, we were able to grab two spots at the bar.   2. A very cute bartender quickly greeted us and got us drinks. His chipper attitude was pleasant and he seemed very nice. He saw that I checked in on Yelp and quickly got us two free buns as part of the Yelp kick-back coupons. My friend got the Chicken and Waffle bun and I got the crab bun - both very good and arrived amazingly fast.   3. We gave our order and waited at least 40 minutes before I called someone over and asked where our food was - this was the worst part. The bartender did apologize and was very attentive to our drinks, but we still had to wait an extraordinary about of time for what seemed like very basic meals.   4. The kitchen is tiny. For the size of the restaurant and the amount of people they are committing to serve, the kitchen is way to small. You don't sacrifice kitchen space for a larger dining room when you have a complex menu - that just means you're going to be making people wait for your mediocre food and extend your wait time to unreasonable amounts.   5. Okay - calling the food mediocre might be a little harsh. But it certainly wasn't worth possibly waiting 40 minutes for a table and then another 40 minutes for the food to come out. We ended up taking the food to go and the manager comped the check, which was nice. However, no amount of comps makes up for a bad experience.   I probably won't return here. Nothing about the experience made it worthwhile enough for a second chance.

oOX3AhJ6qBjBnfNlD3hFQQ.text: This is my boyfriends absolute favorite restaurant.  Their pork ramen bowl is his go-to every time and I swear he could eat that forever if he only had one option to choose for the rest of his life.  I, too, love many options on their menu. They have delicious sriracha wings as an appetizer, an excellent spicy duck curry that I swear by and sweet banana hush puppy things for dessert.   Everything is amazing. There hasn't been anything I've order that I haven't enjoyed.

CbnAHY1jgNyvRhiXEkiO6w.text: Went on a Friday afternoon for lunch. It was decently busy, so we opted for seats at the bar.   I ordered a French 75, my favorite, as a drink, and it was very well made!  We opted to try the tuna chips and steam buns as an appetizer. We ordered the pork belly, crab, and chicken and waffle one. The tuna chips were my favorite appetizer! The pork belly bun was delicious and I would absolutely get that one again! The other two were ok, I was disappointed in the flavors and the waffle was soggy, so neither were as great as the pork belly, so I would not order those again.   For lunch we shared the chicken katsu sandwich and a shrimp pad Thai. Game changer you guys- both were incredible! I highly recommend both entrees and the fries! Holy wow, will definitely order again.   Our server was nice and knowledgeable. We will absolutely be back.

1jl4FyFF-cMmM_qlOFOx9g.text: TLDR; if it weren't for the ramen, this would be a higher rated review. The ramen was disappointing but everything else was good!  We picked this place because it got voted as best Ramen Shop in Arizona so we wanted to see if it could live up to the hype. We came kind of late on a Monday night so it wasn't too busy and were seated immediately.   If you check in on Yelp, you can get a free steamed bun but it's only one check in per table. We decided on the Pork Belly Bun, and ordered the Brussels Sprouts, Pork Ramen, and Kimchi Cheeseburger.   I was a bit worried about the service because I read a lot of negative reviews that it could've been better. But we didn't wait long for food and they checked in on us every now and then.   Pork Belly Bun: This was so good. They stuff a fat slab of pork belly in between a steamed bun. The pork belly is just slightly crispy along the edges and the bun compliments all the fat on the meat.   Brussels Sprouts: This had an interesting Asian twist, in a good way. I usually expect the vegetable to be cooked in some form of balsamic vinegar. It was a good dish to share between people.  Kimchi Cheeseburger: In my opinion, the burger was average. It isn't spicy if you're worried about that. I didn't expect them to put slices of daikon in the burger so that was a nice surprise. The fries and the gojuchang aioli were probably the best part of this dish.   Pork Ramen: This was not what we were expecting. The soup base tasted more like pho then actual ramen. The best thing in this dish were the thick slabs of pork belly and the carnitas.   Overall, if you're looking for good ramen, I do not recommend this place. But this place does have happy hour daily and a cocktail menu. If I were to visit again, I'd aim for those.

XWfg18osvSVMWN74YhXpUg.text: Waited forever during mid afternoon and the food was not very good. Out of four meals, we all agreed only one was enjoyable.   Although, the server was very polite and attentive.   The place had a cool vibe but the wait was needlessly long and the majority of the food was sub par.

-IIEWribONF_oRJ6rgymIQ.text: So I wanted to hate this place, given the past 2 times I've come it's been a 2 hour wait either due to the rain restricting patio usage or big business events which ended up causing  me to find another restaurant. However, when I came to this establishment this past Friday I ended up having one of the best dining experiences I've had in Phoenix.  Ambiance: When you walk in, the ambiance to me seemed somewhat minimalist. Nice modern wooden furniture in a low light romantic setting. The outside patio is also really cute next to these plants and beams above. We ended up opting to sit at the bar as we were both hungry and seating was available immediately. Pro tip: call ahead and see what the wait is going to be like. On weekends there can be some pretty long waits.  Drinks: Sitting next to the bar was a real treat. These guys take their cocktails very seriously. Our bartender/server was so nice and friendly despite having to man a long line of people. He also was quiet the showman when mixing drinks. Pouring the boozy concoctions with an open Boston shaker so you could see the liquids coming in and out. All of the drinks we had were amazing! The level of detail and display from drinkware to the garnishes was stunning. I like smoky drinks so of course my favorite cocktail was Up In Smoke.   Food: I have been on a hunt to find a ramen place to replace my current go to spot in Phoenix and I think I found it. I ordered what ended up being some of the tastiest and tenderest ramens I've had in a long time. We also got a bowl of pad Thai and a soft shell crab bun that was heavenly. I could eat those soft shell buns all day.  All in all, the exotic food, exceptional cocktails, great service and ambiance make this place a five star experience for me. I can not wait to be back for happy hour to have more of this places amazing options in food and cocktails!

Osu4oL_x8DWS6pQ9PEcIkg.text: Ok, where do I start?  First off, I travel (a lot).  The highlight of traveling for work is the hunt for restaurants to satisfy a foodie like me.  Clever Koi has the presence of a wonderful chef in Chef Anthony.  I've been here twice now and purposely stayed closer to the Koi than my clients to eat the food.  Today was Szechuan Catfish.  I'm not a huge catfish person, but I'm chef's recommendation I tried it.  Holy s$*t.  One of the best things I've ever eaten. The fish was delicate, the heat hit just right. In layers with a build up. Snow peas for crunch and shiitake and Chinese eggplant.  Even the cilantro served a purpose. Try this. Try the crispy duck leg. Try the soft shell crab steamed bun and tuna chips.  The food, the service and just the friendly faces almost made me forget it will be 120 degrees in Phoenix soon.  The soup tasting will have to wait until winter!!!  Thanks chef Anthony. Like I told you tonight, "you cook the way o would cook if I knew how to cook better."   See you in a few weeks         **.  Been 6 times, which is a lot considering I live in Texas.   Haven't had a bad dish and I order something different every time.  Had Pork Ramen and calamari fries last night.  Aside from stellar food, the servers are attentive and amazing.

YalGnlLLS-xJ-eXDsMSqHg.text: I wanted to like this place. Ambience is great but food is subpar... I tried 5 items too. Service was okay. Server asked me what I thought of their food, and I was thinking hard what to say. He asked me again what I didn't like about them so I pointed out what items were burnt and what was too sour. And he goes on to explain why they were still done correctly. Correctly prepared or not, your food needs serious improvement if you want to live up to all the great reviews here.   High rating on Yelp was the reason I spent a lot more than I normally do on dinner, because I was only visiting and didn't want to miss out on great foods. If you've never been here and are reading this, you're not missing out anything.

7sGKfVSFqrhIzq-PM2QHEA.text: The best ramen I have ever had. The drinks were delicious, the music was amazing. Service was excellent. Great environment for a date, solo dining or group. I will be back whenever I am in Phoenix. They should open one in Austin TX, the vibe is amazing.

PAY1GI_dB0rwkD8LiBqGQw.text: Outstanding Asian fusion food! The ramen is amazing and they have vegetarian, chicken, and pork belly options. Appetizers are fun! The pork belly bun, my friends and I call the 'Jesus taco', because it is that good! Ask for Mary -she's the best!!

b6e_jC6w6Tw0gLDqMjkVaQ.text: I don't think I'll ever stop loving this place. As soon as you walk in you feel welcomed.  From the staff, to the food, to the drinks, this restaurant truly moves like a well oiled machine. Their happy hour is from 11am-6pm so it never disappoints, and their bar is larger than most so plenty of seating. Only thing I'm sad about is I'm moving soon! But A+!!

FlvIo2e_9jaj_8T2WT5jGg.text: Relaxed ambience, great music, and good presentation of food!   Was around the neighborhood and was craving for ramen. Thanks to Yelp, I decided to check in here. Okay first things first, they have happy hours throughout the day till 6 pm mostly week days. They give a FREE bun ( your choice of protein) for Yelp check in.   Now coming to the food, not so happy with the pork ramen. I just felt the broth was too thick, it didn't had the rich touch to it. Too gingery in taste to be precise. However, the pork katsu was heavenly. Very mellow and crispy outside. Pork bun was average. Xo noodles were good in taste but it had too much of fried onions and garlic all around.   Above all this, the best seller was TUNA CHIPS and it was solid good. The raw and soft flavor of tuna with some spice and guacamole. OMG that's my new favorite here.  This place is slightly higher in prices. We paid around 36$ (excluding tips) for the 3 items. The presentation of food and ambience is heavenly. Not all but some items are to die for. Rest average taste. However, I will be coming back to try some their other items for sure. Because this place is definitely promising.  Bdw they have an open kitchen yet the place is super CLEAN.

If you go in a smaller group they are relatively fast.  They have a very simple Lunch Menu, you need to select the type of Rice/ Noddle's , Meat, Veggies, Sides.  I love fried rice with Eggs, Lemongrass chicken,  Mushroom, Kimchi and Pickled ginger combination. I once went to eat dinner and found the appetizers expensive and with very less quantity. ND9NAC13ENaseYLh1aF2uQ.text: The Clever Koi is a modern take on traditional Asian cuisine. They serve wonderful noodle dishes, steamed buns and house made dumplings. They also have an interesting and exciting mix of hand crafted cocktails. It has a comfortable modern setting with a nice long bar and expansive patio that faces Central.   We stopped in for happy hour the other day and were pleasantly surprised with the prices and variety of cocktails and eats. We started with the beets, they came with cucumber, pickeled ginger, bean curd and a lemongrass vinaigrette. It was beautifully plated, but the amount of soy was so overwhelming it was difficult to eat(and the beets weren't completely ripe). For the noodle bowl we tried the roasted pork, it came with bacon, mustard greens, bean sprouts, shitake mushrooms and a soft egg. It was delicious. I had to try the steamed buns and went for the squid sausage that the bartender recommended. It was amazing and I loved the aioli it was dressed in.  I had "The Enabler" which was hickory whiskey, grilled lemon juice, burlesque bitters. It had a slow smoke flavor that stayed in my mouth long after the drink was done.  The bartenders were awesome, we had a great experience and will definitely be back.

yQpba21CfAkJIP-WGzILrg.text: Wasn't impressed with the inside (small and uncomfortable) or the take out (not as much flavor as I'd hoped). I think this is one of those places where you either love it or you go to back to your usual Vietnamese and Thai restaurants that have much more flavor!

K31rFB65GUV9OlCcdpXlJg.text: very good food!!! We sat at the bar and it was very entertaining. Super good drinks, nice waitstaff. It ended up being a bit pricey but that was more on us. The seafood hot pot was amazing!!

Everyone was super knowledgeable and the food was really good. The short rib and chicken dumplings where great. I forget the name of the fluffy little Asian taco sandwiches but the pork belly ones where sooooooooo freaking good. My girlfriend got the weird vegetarian curry thing and even that was really good. Try this place, you won't be disappointed.

3bcbROnykPVlN792-xHGCQ.text: This place is so cute and has a nice vibe. They have signature drinks that's are made with lots of love. I had the Spicy Noodles and they were so good and lived up to the spice.

daUa9ORHgX01e5nsXDJYQw.text: Came for Restaurant Week and loved the place. Sat outdoors and the weather was good. We shared the teriyaki short rib which was amazing with the apple & daikon kimchi. We also had the pork face dumplings - they were good, but not the best I've ever had.   We both had the seared hamachi which was heavenly. The sauce helped make the dish and I had a weird love for the mushrooms that were in the dish too.   As for the desserts.. I hope I remember mine forever. The banana fritters were the best dessert I've ever had. The soft dough with five spice sugar, the bananas that seemed to be melting, and the red miso caramel had me almost crying in-between bites.    I checked out the happy hour menu and I definitely wanna go back again.

2zW_VB1tb-cNn_S0S90Y4w.text: We popped in on a whim and are so glad we did! The ambiance was gorgeous, the employees were super adorable, friendly and helpful, but most importantly, the food was incredible!! 2 of my friends ordered the Seafood Hot Pot and said it was spicy and delicious. My son and I shared the Kimchi Fried Rice with duck, and Pork Belly Ramen. Both were magnificent. We also all shared the Tuna Chips with Wasabi Guacamole and Calamari Fries appetizers. Every item we tried was seasoned beyond expectation! It was a flavor explosion with every bite, and they were reasonably priced as well! It's hard to satisfy a party of 5. Great job, Clever Koi!

dVwweco6WYMhUu9Xwmh62Q.text: Trendy Asian food.  Not worth it if you are really want real Asian.  Mostly noodles. Had their XO noodles.  Shrimp and scallops tiny. Hard to find peas.   Flavor good but it could have been any noodle.  Nothing unique.  Great service and good sake.

t4VnlEJB6OX4QZd6ykfijw.text: This is my second time at The Clever Koi! A friend introduced this to us for her anniversary dinner. When I first thought of it, the food was going to be okay. But I thought wrong!  The first time around I ordered soft shell steamed bun, tasted AMAZING! From what I remembered it was fried and what made it amazing was their sauce that came with the steamed bun. I also ordered their top orders which was the pork belly ramen. Again, the flavor was amazing!!! The pork is crispy, it comes with egg, and kimchee and of course the ramen.  The second time I visited, I ordered their pork steamed bun, again their sauce and how the pork is cooked makes it the best! And for my meal I ordered their seafood ramen soup. Their noodle is more of a udon soup rather than ramen but still tasted good! The seafood inside the soup was fresh, not over cooked either. The best part of going to this place is their service. They are quick to serve and will take good care of you especially Mike whom does a nice job making sure you are taken care of. Good job, Mike, the cooks, and the owners who thought of putting their own twist to Asian style cooking!!

photos.caption: Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pork steamed bun, sauce is so good!

UbaBP1xhYNIQL-Ejx4hQ6A.text: OMG! My girl found this spot for a "romantic" place that stayed open late on a Friday night!  Great option! I haven't seen a bar this extensive with fresh ingredients since I left Atlanta 6 years ago.  EVERYTHING is custom and fresh! Even the fresh eucalyptus on the tables and fresh flowers in the bathroom. My cocktail had fresh thyme! Win Win! Let Me not get started on the food!  We had about 6 different dishes all they were all good. The kimchi fried rice with duck was like an orgasm in My mouth! I just found our new date spot!  Thanks Clever Koi

-vTK6h_iHCIBvgUaF-iQ2Q.text: First time here and most likely last.  Pros: - I got to spend nearly two hours with my family.  Cons: - Took over 40-minutes for the food to come out. Only one other group was there... - About 10 people working and none of them helped. We had to ask for refills multiple times. - We had 4 different servers and none of them were competent. - The last two beers we got were from the bottom of the barrel and were chunky. - My water smelt like wet dog?.... I love dogs and know what this smells like!  Bad bad service.

9bePVi92OS2hXw8AaXa20w.text: My coworker Mario lives just down the street from Cleaver Koi, and I've been jonesing to try this new restaurant ever since I heard about it over the summer. I picked up a menu to study prior to ordering. We ended up splitting the seafood hot pot, lamb pastrami and Peking duck steamed buns, smoked "pig face" dumplings and Chinese long beans. While the hot pot was good, I probably wouldn't order it again (but I'm not a huge soup person, unless it's pho). The house bacon lured me to order the Peking duck, and while it was delicious on its own it wasn't as amazing as the lamb pastrami. Good gravy that meat rocked! The pig face dumplings are packed with guanciale and is absolutely heavenly paired with kimchi. The long beans with crispy duck tongue were as awesome as it sounds--the lightly battered and fried tongues taste slightly like mushrooms and melt in your mouth.  Overall, we were both impressed with Cleaver Koi. The food was great and reasonably priced. The music was hip but not too loud. While there is outside seating, it's far too cold to enjoy. Regardless, I'm already planning my next meal for when I return.

0lE9S9Z3Ogee2poCcMU8ow.text: This was my first visit to The Clever Koi. I didn't know what to expect, and this eating establishment wowed me! I was very happy with my overall experience. From the service, to the ambiance, music, good positve vibe, and most of all, the FOOD! This is what I call a True fusion of different Asian dishes with American and other cuisines.   It was a little late so I ordered the Soft Shell Crab from The Small Plates menu, which was served with julienned green apple, smoked daikon radish, fingerling potato, and buttered panang sauce. It was a total explosion of wonderful savory flavors in my mouth, not to mention, the texture. This dish really left a good impression in my mouth and my mind. I also ordered the Chicken and Waffle, a kimchi waffle with scallions, and chili maple. It was surprisingly good. I will definitely recommend this place to friends and family and I will be back to try the other offerings on their menu.

U-IiBNZ7XOZLhLp2dQBb1A.text: We arrived at Clever Koi without reservations and found this place very busy. We were greeted right away and told it would be 45 minutes.  Our party of 4 decided to wait it out. We were surprised at the size of the place. Very small w a larger bar area.   After our 45m wait, we were seated and forgot about for at least 20 more mins. Even after finally getting a server she was not very attentive.... dropped off menus... never asked about if we had been there before or made any suggestions.  I dislike that. A little small talk is needed. I dont like to feel like a number, next guest.  Overall, the food wasnt anything to write home about. I actually disliked the ramin I got.   I dont recommend this place...other places in the area are better in terms of service and food

-oU6zSfTvhfz6vmVEONAeQ.text: Visited this restaurant couple of time for dinner. Excellent food and very happy with black rice as well as noodles. I was really impressed with vegetarian options as well. Service was excellent.

j7kbOUvSKlyMQpPuCf2CKw.text: AWESOME, AWESOME, AWESOME, Nick and Partners great job on managing your business. This place is spot on, the food, cocktails and service hit the mark. My wife and I really enjoyed our dinning experience, this is what going out is all about. Go Check this place out.

xOqm8N75Nju1kbcmRYy5AQ.text: Love love their ramen. The flavor is amazing, the choices are great for the build your own. I've ordered the chow mein on Uber eats and it was good but not great. Maybe it would be better fresh at the restaurant rather than take out. Service can be patchy too, nothing terrible but slow even during lunch when the restaurant isn't busy. But given how delicious the ramen is, I'll be back!

GVAYJ7mK9PZg6S3ZB7ZVew.text: We went with a group of 5- would highly recommend coming with a large group so you can try everything  Would get again: the ramen! Absolutely delicious, the poached egg was perfect. The dumplings were moist & perfect, with a nice touch of spice. The house made sriacha was an added bonus. Would also recommend the steamed buns (the bottom two on the list- pork bacon? And lamb?) can't remember. But also very good  For me, the katsu is not my cup of tea. It was actually very good but I do not prefer fried chicken meals. My bf, however, loved it.   This place is actually easier for picky eaters to enjoy than I would have expected. We will definitely be back.  Also! Relatively cheap, we were all stuffed & paid twenty a person with tip! The ambience is pretty laid back & the lighting isn't too dark which I absolutely hate about Asian restaurants.

s4W-EmlSSSl3fYgjhUHP2w.text: My friend and I popped in quickly for lunch. David was our server and helped us navigate the lunch menu. We were in a huge rush and our food arrived promptly. Food was really good, fresh and well prepared.  Looking forward to trying them for dinner

UpiRkl0TnCY4Ays07y5KBQ.text: One of my favorite places in Phoenix. I like how their menu changes slightly over time, so there's something new to try. Everything I've tried is good so far, and I've almost tried everything on the menu. I don't like the pig face dumpling as much, actually prefer the other dumplings. I love the stream buns, especially the chicken waffle and the pork belly steam buns. Their ramen and seafood hot pot is excellent, but wasn't impressed by their duck dishes.

-Or5uqYoxhLr1beWxvQfCg.text: I love this place! If I could give it more stars I certainly would. I had dinner there last night which was the 3rd time I'd eaten there in about a month and as always, everything exceeded my expectations. They have got it down pat, amazing food, awesome service, (both front of the house and back) and owners and employees who are passionate about their restaurant! This was my first time sitting at the kitchen bar, where I could see the guys in the kitchen who work so hard. It is obvious watching them prepare the food that they are completely engaged and dedicated. Chef Jared Porter is one of Phoenix's best, if not the best, in my opinion. He continues to create fresh, flavorful dishes using exceptional ingredients put together in such interesting ways. I crave this food, it's like comfort food without being heavy like most comfort food tends to be. We started out with a couple of the "small plates", Tuna Chips and the Black Bean and Celery Root Pancakes. For the record, I have ordered these the last 3 times I've been there, they are that amazing! For dinner we shared the Fried Forbidden Black Rice, what a perfect pairing of flavors, slightly sweet, incredibly flavorful without being salty or spicy. Honestly, I love their flavor combinations as much as anything else about the place. We ordered the Grilled Stone Fruit dessert which totally hit the spot, not overly sweet, but sweet enough, with just the right balance of sweet and savory. Not only is the food amazing, but it seems as though every person on staff is happy to be there and cares about the guests. This might be my favorite restaurant, at least until I try their new spot when it opens in Gilbert in the early fall.

uU3Ng6CLJLy8vS0kJdUp7w.text: This Asian fusion restaurant blew me away!  We came in for lunch for our first time and tried out their tasty little build-your-own-bowl options. First off, the place is hip and beautifully-decorated, cozy yet chic. It's a very nice spot in Phoenix. It's set up with an open-kitchen look, so it's fun to watch the chef-owners cooking the food with fresh ingredients and lively attitudes. The food was AMAZING. BEST pork belly steamed bun I've ever had in my life--it was with just the right amount of sauce and crispy, flavorful, and crackling with tasty fat! I also had the stir fry chow mein with steak. They know how to cook their meat here! Their steak is amazing: tender and juicy and bursting with flavor. My partner had their dashi broth with noodles and it was light, refreshing, and unique. These guys know how to make sophisticated and inventive flavor profiles that are still respectful of their traditional bases and still reminiscent of that delicious Asian comfort food we all know and love. I will come here again and again; this is our new favorite restaurant in Phoenix!  (Pro-tip: come from weekday lunch! It's PACKED during dinner time and a reservation is highly recommended! Also very loud in the evenings!)

qGhPYYBmUOKWdEpszFHaDQ.text: I'm from SOCAL and found this place via yelp. WOW. That's all I can say about this place. The chicken and waffle dumpling was way over the top and then I washed that down with the seafood pot. AMAZING. I washed all of it down with two cocktails which were also insanely great. The vibe felt like it should be in LA or San Diego and the food was easily the best thing I have had traveling in a long time. I would absolutely eat here again and probably will before I bounce. GREAT FOOD...GREAT DRINKS...GREAT PLACE

Ekt635jswlB5nFOsZbS9Fw.text: I was there a week ago, service was good apps were good the noodle bowls a little salty but ok. I got the peach fritter and was disappointed it was like a donut hole but too dense and just a speck of peach. A peach fritter should be easy here is a suggestion how to do make it if you have not already fixed it,  use fresh peaches probable from costco, cut into wedges, dust with cornstarch and use a tempura batter made with peach nectar and a little vanilla  I hope this helps and good luck with a great concept

kls2mfAhtWnq5iU8xAxrbg.text: Super high quality food and the service was great. Very educated waiter. Can't wait to go back.

twexTvXAIjXJFJnN-9RxsA.text: If you don't eat here...you need your head examined. I seriously think I touched a little slice of heaven as I shoved the fork in my mouth...over and over and over again. I wish I had a bigger stomach so I could keep ordering, and eating. Its so delicious, and I want to go back every single day...and sadly, tomorrow is Sunday, and they are closed. I guess if they bring you to Heaven, they also deserve a day of rest. Amen!  EAT HERE, I PROMISE, You Will Love It.

O8JRnMh7xYAjFKZjgTH_Xg.text: WENT HERE for a girls night out and I loved it we all did. Great service everyone was chill yet professional and the food is so yummy. One of my top places

S6kBVoetaZ8JhAreOQvFWQ.text: Very unique menu and tastes. Lots of craft cocktails. Staff were friendly and helpful. Upbeat hip vibe. A little loud for our old ears. A tad pricey. Deserves 4.5 stars!

JRkc_IvGfe7fXLZ6FCpPyQ.text: Their Asian inspired food was delicious. If that wasn't enough to get a person to come back their cocktails are always so creative, and taste superb. Having now gone here since they have opened I have always loved the new seasonal menus that they come up with. Have yet to be disappointed!

6Hs7LYpGTjs8t-KQoVvB_Q.text: Absolutely loved this place and cannot wait to go back! The customer service was incredible and the food was so delicious! This place is very busy so make sure you make reservations, yes even during the week! Must try is the Banana Fritters and apps!

I-n477QpckrRa7n_x9YBZw.text: We came for a work event. They preordered appetizers for the event. The food was unique, fresh and very flavorful. The drinks were oddly ho hum to me. I'd come back for the food tho!

HXwApJOzRvKSUTGJi6WkxQ.text: Most items on the menu contain pork or sausage. I had the Kung Pao Fried Chicken without the Chinese sausage. Came with confit potatoes, peas, peanuts, and this delicious chili sauce on your choice of brown or white rice. The chicken had just the right amount of spice. It was delicious! Wish we had one of these in D.C.

8gWgYaAMII9OTVi_vaF1jQ.text: This place is nice and hip. The customer service is outstanding and the noodles are delicious. I really liked the drinks, we had the tropical ice tea and grapefruit soda and it was delicious. I just wish they would put a bit more broth in the bowls; other than that this place is really good.

81FvzmZZdWMDelbnsue9yw.text: Amazing service and amazing food. Many items made in house that you would never think of. Great selection of small entrees and their menu changes seasonally. Get the tuna chips and veal potstickers. Also the oyster beer is great.

8dIm5cSusTUN__TLqOv4gQ.text: Delicious and fresh food, and great service!  The octopus in both of our meals was delicious. We both got seafood options, and they were great! We also ordered the donuts for dessert, and they were so tasty!  The portions aren't huge, but I guess it helps with not over-eating!  We will definitely return!

cL15FTUgtbbGPYo2kCukFA.text: Awesome ramen, very flavorful and great service. Place is small but very cute and well decorated. Great lunch spot!

RmqFzmYdrr670xwNRzN8yA.text: I would not recommend Clever Koi. Food was not bad but was not worth it, especially since there are so many great restaurants in this area. We had a table of eight and everyone ordered something different. Not even one meal was above average.   The decor and ambiance was nice sitting outside on the patio.   Service during the meal wasn't horrible but we went through all the water and was never asked if we wanted a refill. Our server did answer questions and gave recommendations.   But the worst part of the night was that our server told US to figure out the separate  bills. One of us just ended up paying.   Overall, I will not return. There are so many better restaurants in this area.

GZIWNmGAm7VfxYAGox8jHQ.text: If you don't like this place then you are insane or you have simply been in Phoenix too long. I am so glad that this place is in our area and it is exactly what Phoenix needs to take our restaurant scene in a different direction.  The menu is very eclectic and you can explore some great flavorful options. Salt and pepper shrimp and pig face dumplings are amazing.  Then try any of the bowls. The beef is my favorite.  The staff are super friendly and they are very passionate about the place.

e0fdNzSVmtTFc8wG1oNJNg.text: This place never disappoints. I came in for lunch for the first time yesterday to find a great deal on the build-your -own bowls. I had chow mein with shrimp, broccoli, and mushrooms- very good. Servers are always there when you need them. The only negative I'd mention is a piece of a cold udon noodle on top of my chow mein, lol. You can see it in my picture...Servers should pay attention to detail when they're running food out to tables...

6wndslEkCg__7tgG-BmZTg.text: Delicious food! Top Notch Service, knowledgeable servers! Amazing ambiance! I just loved being there!

pPiTgTxH2lCNtbjmlJwRcQ.text: The artistic presentation is one thing but the flavors you experience are stupendous!!

XfC5ye2BDvQ18gaN4Ad3zg.text: My husband and I ate here Wednesday night because of a YELP review and the review was so True.  This was one of the best dinners I have had in a long time.  This very modern Asian restaurant has an incredible menu and with the suggestions of our FANTASTIC server David, we ordered the Pig Face Dumplings, Chicken & Waffles Steamed Buns, S&S Chicken with Rice and Spicy Seafood Hot Pot.   Yes a lot of food, we took leftovers home but only after eating Banana Foster Fritters.  Not a large red wine selection but I tried a excellent red wine from Greece and was extremely pleased. What a great place, with great people and wonderful food. Can't wait to go back for lunch.

57fK82YRb1D7Jtk8ekkNQA.text: Went for lunch. Had the Ramen Ramen bowl w pork.  It was delicious.  Waiter was super helpful with suggestions.   Been several times and it always great.

CQXx79B5IUumiuAu-96wiA.text: Went here for lunch today. Green Tea Noodle salad. I don't typically like cold noodles, but this was quite good. My husband started with the beet salad which was also quite good. For my main meal I ordered the chow mein with shrimp. Much to my delight it came with pieces of catfish and scallops. Yum! My husband got the pork something. I don't eat meat so I wasn't interested, but he liked it.  Restaurant is nicely decorated. The only thing that I didn't like was the smoke. The restaurant is an open floor plan so the kitchen is right there. Unfortunately, the smoke from the kitchen easily wafts throughout the entire restaurant. I just smelled my shirt and I still smell like food. Also, you can't get anything from the dinner menu at lunch so we will return for dinner to try that delicious looking shrimp & scallop appetizer.

IKLV_nWF9ro45PGFkvZ86w.text: Found a brillo pad metal hair in our seafood noodles, but the staff was good looking, so I'll be back. Pig face dumpling with kimche was yummy, duck sticky bun was better then lamb sticky bun. Why didn't they comp the whole the meal? They only comped the brillo pad noodles, if I'm pooping blood I'm going to be mad.

S8kDFXbxt7J5Tg_f5qICNg.text: I met a friend here for happy hour on a Friday right after work.   It is new, right next door to George and Dragon.  The patio faces central but has some really nice long wooden benches with cushions and small tables.   Inside has a great long bar area with table seating as well. Plus this open fireplace that they use for cooking the meats. We were watching as they cook this meat and let the juices drip onto whatever they were cooking underneath it.  Mouth watering!  I had the ramen noodle soup and a beer. The soup was amazing. They drop a egg in there with some pork and other goodies. On happy hour it's only like $5, come on that's awesome.   I'm definitely going to come back for more.

3q7SoNKy69-7pfniRmbxdA.text: Excellent food, drinks, service and atmosphere. Cool without being pretentious. The duck curry ramen was incredible, and filling; my boyfriend and I shared it. We also shared the steam buns, tried all three. The crab was the best, but all were interesting and delicious. The drinks were made REALLY REALLY well, with amazing selection of fresh fruit, homemade mixers great selection. The owner was approachable and just really very nice.

wQCgo3x_9Hbbvo9tssQE0g.text: Just recently discovered this restaurant and can not get enough of it! The atmosphere, service, and food is on point. Try the pork belly steam buns to start they are my favorite.

YTG65ZWkl0fre23RzqE07g.text: Always happy with Clever Koi. The menu is unique and the service is always good. I like how the owners all work there because you can tell they really care about their customers and the experience that they have.

vNl_nT-wWK2APKFUoBKvlg.text: Best Asian fusion in Phoenix. They do spicy really well.  Try the smoked and grilled octopus.

vhZ9f41OtMPXt5BWTeO4Mw.text: Amazing! From the food to the service to the ambiance. A great local spot to check out. The food is delish, but the drinks are better. We met one of the owners and fell even more in love with the place. They truly care about your dining experience. A must go to!

There was some interesting food choices that you do not normally see which made the meal fun!  The parking lot is very small and i had to park on the street, the bar George and Dragon was not kind to sharing their lot! The space is fun and i want to go back for drinks, just to enjoy the patio!

WZuJBn2kZCp2pu-cB-h7aA.text: Asian fusion at its best! Dumplings, sweet buns and the tuna chips were amazing. My favorite dumpling was the pork belly, so smokey, so tender! The corn fritter dumplings were a must have! Speciality cocktails out the wazoo! I feel like you cant go wrong on this menu! Great ambiance too boot!

lYiHnOvjVDKq2G2jJBFtVA.text: We had a fantastic experience here tonight! We shared several small bites including the soft shell crab bun, goat cheese dumplings, kimchi chicken and waffles and the short rib appetizer. We shared the pad thai entree with shrimp and finished our meal with the banana fritters and pear rice cobbler - yum!!! Prices are reasonable and the service was wonderful! This restaurant is a must if you're in the central Phoenix area!!

6stmaVVvZc46nPGDiYJJHg.text: Very good place. Nicely decorated, beautiful bathrooms, and great food. My only complaint was that the girl behind the counter was unable to answer my questions clearly. I was trying to understand what the kids' plates included. I had to ask about ten questions and still did not fully understand. I finally gave up and ordered an adult dish for my daughter. But otherwise everything was terrific.

UJWdnUBaxAyHdDdxQKj9pw.text: Clever Koi is always a good idea. After checking out Across the Pond recently, we were left underwhelmed and hungry so we decided to satisfy our hunger by eating here. We started off with cocktails, I had the bees knees which never disappoints. Some standout dishes we had was the chicken and waffle bun which never disappoints and their galbi short ribs. I don't know why I've never had the ribs before, but they were delicious. We also got tuna chips, which are one of my favorite items on their menu. Light, yet satisfying.

kjYlj6qnD9Q-ggks2avwMA.text: Yum yum yum!!! The owner or owners of this place had a vision and are killing it!!! From the moment you walk in the experience at CK is delightful. Here's a place I don't mind waiting for when they are busy. Everything I've tried on the menu is flavorful and serving are just enough (for me). The servers and bartender that I've had the pleasure of meeting, know the menu and go above an beyond if needed. Good people. Good energy.

YF8OybbNW8-JQj_PqrIyow.text: This review is for take out only! I ordered the duck curry and was pretty impressed by the presentation, it looked awesome.  Very interesting combination. I did enjoy the curry and the duck. The heat was nice, the spices blended well. I was not a fan of the peppers and I wish it was served with rice instead of udon.  Besides that everything was good and I will make sure to try out some of their other dishes.

7sZlnM_q526QcbYrz_AgLQ.text: Love this place! very relaxed space and clean! the buns are amazing and the seafood soup was superb. Anytime I am downtown I try to stop by here for the yummy food!

photos.caption: Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ssd9MpeztFzSGxAtp0nOSw.text: Struggling to muster a breath in between bite and glorious bite of my pork ramen, I exclaimed, "if I were to die on death row, this would make a hell of a last meal." That's all you need to know. I'm currently grieving over finishing my dish now. Just do it.

0dvfUam2Jj_ty9TWmH_CQg.text: Clever Koi is a solid restaurant that could definitely become stunning with a few changes. Parts of the restaurant were lovely and parts were underwhelming.  I'm going to lead with what went right on our visit. Service was prompt and good, just the right balance of being attentive without being overwhelming.   The ambiance was stellar, I felt like I was somewhere along the California coast. We sat in the patio area which had comfy seats, and well groomed and taken care of plants.   The bao style buns were perfectly executed - we had the soft shell and catfish. They came with a soy like sauce which I felt was unnecessary and didn't add anything to the dish. These pair well with their green house sriracha.   The house hot sauces are delicious, not to spicy but just enough kick with actual flavor. We found the red to be smoky and the green to be sweet.   The bao were pricey, but did at least deliver. They offer three for $12.50 which puts you at $4.17 a piece. The problem is when you have two people, usually you need four and get stuck purchasing the fourth for $4.50. I would recommend any above three be priced at $4.17 so you don't feel overcharged.   The corn dumplings were good and presented nicely, but I just cannot get behind the $10 price tag - $7.50 would be closer to their value. The dumplings were also served in a very large bowl only half full.   The Pad Thai was our least favorite.. it's not that the ingredients chosen weren't fresh and of quality.. it was the execution. Nothing was overcooked, but the sauce did not deliver. The sauce was a muddy mess between a Pad Thai you would expect and a satay sauce that fell into the mix. I much prefer a more classic Pad Thai, which is a perfect balance of heat, sweet and tang. The toasted peanut pieces, strong cilantro and tang of lime were missing here. I wish the menu clarified this dish was more of a satay sauce, because I would have gone another route.   All proteins in the Pad Thai were extra. I didn't feel the 4 medium shrimp were quite enough for a $5 add in. I would like to see 6 shrimp or 4 extra large for this dish.  The dessert selection made it tough to choose. They make their own house mochi and today it was Fruity Pebbles - how creative. There was also a pineapple upside down cake and banana fritters. We opted for the banana fritters.  The banana fritters were coated with sugar and spice like donut holes and served with a salty caramel. I would have liked to have seen less sugar on the outside of the fritters, because I felt it limited my use of the delicious caramel sauce. The ice cream was extra and for $4.50 you got two mini scoops which accounted for about a scant 1/2 cup serving. I would expect to pay no more than $3 for the portion of ice cream which was of average quality.  No drinks were ordered and the bill came to $59.19 with tax. My recommendation is go for the buns, ambience and skip the Pad Thai.

sVBwrTnePbEPrkyqgRGhGQ.text: Fantastic food. Delicious drinks. I have absolutely nothing bad to say about this place. They do everything right.

fru5RfnLaH_uZkbdRKMIZQ.text: This place is awesome! Cleaver Koi does a great job of  creating awesome asian fusion food within all the menu. I love the Ramen here and specifically the lemon pepper chicken ramen. Perfect broth and very flavorful! It's an adult chicken noodle soup that's perfect anytime. I really enjoy everything I've had here and will frequently come back

uXgfbgAt06mlGVrCDBxQ5w.text: Went here for lunch today was seated and given water fast. Around 5 minutes later ordered the Pork and XO ramen and waited and waited asked about 20 minutes in was told would be soon....after a hour asked and.....they lost the order ticket and we were never served. We left hungry but I am unsure if the food is good or bad as no food is always bad. The place is nice and smells great nice looking bar also.

gJ2QjpP693f2QqKpVQRBFw.text: Unique Asian fusion establishment. We came during Restaurant Week on a Saturday, so the place was hopping. Wait was 30-40 minutes, but we had some cocktails while we waited.  The cocktail menu is certainly extensive and we each had two of the specialties - I can't remember the names offhand and the cocktail menu isn't available online but they were all novel combinations. I liked both of my drinks and one my wife chose was too sweet for her - but I don't blame the mixologist for that.  The first thing I'll say about the food is to NOT do the restaurant week menu - it is absolutely a rip off. For $33, they give you food that would on the normal menu be $30 or less! Most places where that was the case throw in a drink with the menu, but this one did not. After we realized the math worked that way, we ordered off the main menu.  The calamari fries were excellent, not too chewy with good dipping sauces. We split all four steam buns (ordered 3 initially but checking in on yelp got us a free one!) The pork belly was probably my favorite with its savoriness but all of them were very well done. The chicken n waffle has the bun itself replaced by a waffle. Kimchi cauliflower was a surprising favorite.  XO noodles (my entree) had well-developed flavor to them (a bit on the spicy side, but not excessively so. The ramen (my wife's) was filling and the broth was everything we could have wanted.  Food (and certainly cocktails) would probably merit a ~4.5 stars but I round down because of the blatant restaurant week mispricing as well as slow service - particularly at the bar (it took us ~15 minutes to get a check once our table was ready so we could close out from the bar).

x1utYDObGthbBlkBhIq5Tw.text: Awesome atmosphere. Staff is beyond friendly and very knowledgeable about the menu. Highly recommend the soft shell crab steamed bun and the lemon pepper chicken ramen bowl. Absolutely incredible choices and experience for first time here.

bdMCPveRUKZdrNdwW8_8GQ.text: Really good quality food with great servers. I don't think you will be disappointed with whatever you order. We got the hot pot and the pork chop ramen and they were fantastic.

M_6CPKzW70pN31rReQu7ig.text: Exemplary service and great tasting food! I'm not a fan of cilantro, but without it, the pork ramen was amazing! Admittedly, when I ordered, it still came with it on, but the waitress was very courteous and rectified it at once. There is plenty of parking as well - something people tend to take for granted at a lot of downtown areas. The specials and happy hour are worth coming in for, and it's a lovely place in general. Would definitely go out of my way to visit again!

JwhizkXRKB01_ScaMXCK_w.text: Great cocktails, and the food is mind blowing. I enjoyed a seat on the patio, what a beautiful night. My friends and I were met with impeccable service, beautifully presented dishes and perfectly balanced cocktails. Highly recommend

5bgYjyAfOG8HnDwRhLtWmg.text: A M A Z I N G. I love this place and go often. The drinks here are very unique and super delicious. They also have one of the best happy hour menus in town. The atmosphere is fantastic. And I love that the kitchen is open. It's fun to watch the wok flames go up!

1axnA44JXjmhrru_ClzZFw.text: Amazing staff overall...really enjoyed my time here! Highly recommend this place. Definitely won me over as a customer and will be coming back!

x5zO-MFvICDFICA0--dlPw.text: I've heard great things about this place but found the food mediocre. My friend and I ordered the kimchi fried rice with lemongrass chicken and the lemon pepper chicken ramen. As a huge ramen fan, I was so excited to try this. However, to my disappointment, the broth lacked flavor and to be honest just tasted bland. I had to add lots of pepper to add flavor to it (I can't do spicy... so the fact that I added lots of pepper says a lot). The kimchi fried rice was not too bad, but not great either. Both entrees had generous portion sizes. I wish the food tasted as good they looked.  Everything else was decent. Service was good, the ambiance is cute and there are indoor and outdoor seating areas. I'd come back again to try other items on the menu.

q4zOJOax8q5CjRXBJPxDMA.text: One of my absolute favorite restaurants! I could eat here every night if my budget allowed. The food is delicious and reasonably priced, the staff is friendly, and they have one of the best drink menus in Phoenix. I would definitely recommend!

leZ9-j9vpvatxygMhk_1Pw.text: Quite excited to try this place out during lunch with some girlfriends. Ordered Tuna Chips (Ahi crudo/wasabi guacamole/rice paper chips/bonito aioli), Calamari Fries (mint/furikake/yuzu aioli), Pork Belly Steamed Buns (peanuts/cilantro/hoisin), Roasted Corn Dumplings (sofrito/yuzu marinated tomato/Thai basil/Harissa cream), Short Rib Dumplings (pickled onions/celery leaf salad/shiitake dash/porcini oil), and Seafood Hot Pot (udon/shrimp/calamari steak/scallop/catfish/scallion/cilantro/lime).  The Tuna Chips and Calamari Fries were my favorites, the others were just okay. The highly recommended Seafood Hot Pot was bland to me, it desperately needed some salt or fish sauce. The service was great and attentive. Will give it another try if I ever in the area and try Duck Curry (udon/roasted potato/pickled peppers/peanut/cilantro) and hopefully will be tastier than the Seafood Hot Pot.

eHwU71Pu9F3IkW81MrTfIQ.text: Just wow!  I've come to Clever Koi several times, and every time I get to experience something new and even more delicious.  I personally like to sit at the bar, because you get an upfront view of all the fun cocktails they make.  My favorite bartender by far is Sarah.  She's incredibly knowledgeable about the cocktails and food (she's recommended many things that have been spot on), and she's also really personable and funny!    Some of my favorite things that she has recommended are the Lemongrass Swizzle cocktail (she nudged me to try it with gin instead of vodka, and holy moly was that a good choice!), the Tuna Chips (crudo tuna on a rice paper chip, nachos style), and the Szechuan Catfish. The catfish in particular blew me away!!  It was so tender and flavorful.....I could go back just for that any day!  I absolutely LOVE dining at the Clever Koi, so if you are ever in the neighborhood you should check it out!! :)

EGNQkc48PVUwNqR_bzs_7w.text: Sad. Salty. Mess.  It was the Hubs birthday celebration and Clever Koi have long been on the list of restaurants to try. We both love Asian food , so it was an appropriate choice.   We started with the Galbi and Calamari my husband's two favorite dishes. The galbi was thinly cut and extremely salty. It didn't have the familiar sweetness at the end that you expect. The calamari was cooked well, but the abundance of salt kill the vibes. You did get a hint of yuzu at the end.   Hubs chose the pork ramen and I the Katsu Sandwich. The Ramen was a spicy southwestern take on traditional ramen. The star of ramen is ALWAYS the broth, but this was a picante, overly salted noodle bath. It lacked the balance that a good bowl has.   I was super excited to try the katsu sandwich, because Im always tempted to go on an LA run, for a proper Japanese sandwich. The sandwich consisted of a mu pork katsu cutlet, mustardy slaw and a vinegary/soy/oystery sauce. The Katsu cutlet  was cooked perfectly, but the sauce clashed with the slaw creating a vinegary fight.  I ate one piece of the 4 and took the rest home. I took the bread and slaw off and ate the Katsu as it was. We tried. ** shrugs**   Well if you don't know, now you know...

QaDLni-vqn6FjndIGX15Aw.text: Want to love this place and keep going back, but find it is consistently inconsistent. They have a fab list of classics on the happy hour menu, but last night's penicillin tasted like straight lemon juice- no hints of ginger or peaty scotch. Switched to a negroni which was just meh.   The place gets busy, so maybe that explains why service was a bit scattered. They accidentally brought us someone else's order... 3 times. We finally got our fries and have to say they were tasty.   But overall experience, can't say I'll be back anytime soon.

ewk6I_XsjcS-yi3Qt3RQVQ.text: So, the owner Josh was reprimanding and threatening the bartender's job because of a plate mishap while she was behind the bar... while I watched. It was super unprofessional and it honestly made me not want to go back.   The food is great and Sarah built me the best drink, on the fly. Spicy passion gin is my jam. Sarah was absolutely a sweetheart and if I ever did go back to this place, it would only be because of her. Thank you Sarah!!!  It deserves five stars because that's how delicious it is, but it's getting four because of how uncomfortable I felt watching somebody get reprimanded.

OJfLUd_lCYLYukwvvS9T4w.text: The clever koi.   This restaurant is what urban eateries should feel like. Rapid paced, freshly cooked, and thoroughly detailed. This was an amazing experience for me. The only thing I didn't like was the "buns." Please don't expect them to be actual steam buns like I did. Again this is the urban experience, these are Asian inspired tacos. I liked and disliked them all at the same time. I tried the soft crab and I don't like that it was fried and stuffed in the bun taco. It was just awkward for me.   I had the lemon ramen with added heat and hats off to the kitchen staff. I love heat and I felt it. I loved it.

3BO-G9CYQ9_Btvl0M-h1Rg.text: Outstanding dinner. Stopped in for farewell dinner sending son off to college. We decided to sample a few items and share. We ordered two pork belly buns (one free with check in) and two chicken and waffle buns. Definitely liked the ingenuity, but preferred the pork belly - outstanding flavor. We also had the galbi short ribs, Brussel sprouts (fantastic) and the pork ramen. The ramen was very good but not the best I've had. Nevertheless, I could eat here everyday!

51rXg4fRsxhCzrkYHF32Dw.text: Amazing! Simply amazing! I came to Clever Koi about an hour before they closed and my experience was on point. I sat at the bar because you can watch the bartenders make delicious cocktails. I ordered a French 95 and that drink will always be my go to now from now on. Whisky and champagne, who would ask for anything else? Be sure to try this drink when you come to this restaurant. When using yelp be sure to check in to get your free steamed bun and I got the pork steamed bun which was amazing! The pork belly was cooked to perfection and the home made sauces added more spice and flavor to the pork belly bun. For my entree I ordered the pork ramen. It's not your typical Japanese ramen so don't expect that but it was sooo good! Had lots of pork belly and the broth was amazing. When I come back to PHX I'll be sure to try other dishes from this restaurant.

0PEYqiXKImbGade5rdD_ZQ.text: I went here during a Saturday afternoon and it wasn't too busy. The service was great as was the food. The restaurant is asian fusion so I honestly didn't know what to expect ramen wise.   To my surprise the ramen was actually really good, albeit a tad too salty to my liking. The broth was very rich, noodles chewy, and the pork belly delicious. I was surprised how the ramen has pieces of fried and broiled pork belly. The fried pork belly had a crunch while the broiled belly was so soft it fell apart.   I also checked in and had the soft shell crab bun. That item in my opinion wasn't amazing although worth a try. It had cole slaw with a thousand island like sauce.   The mai Thai is very strong here fyi.   If you want a place with solid food and good aesthetics. Along with  strong drinks this is the place to go!  FYI go to happy hour specialty drinks are $9 and the ramen was $13

However, the ramen doesn't taste authentic but I am very impressed. I would want to visit again to try other items on their menu. And services was good and fast.

1jsXF-sGx-HQef7wr3GrpA.text: My sister recommended this place and so I decided to try it out for myself. The place look small and parking lot is in the back of the restaurant and a bit tight. Busy place though. Inside is very well decorated. It's an open kitchen, everybody was able to see the chef cooking and servers running around. I feel  with us being so close to the kitchen and the music was a little loud, we can barely hear our conversation.  Food is a bit pricy compare to other ramen places. My sister and I ordered the Brussels Sprouts as for the appetizer. Then we ordered Pork Ramen and my younger sister ordered the Shaking Beef. I think the Brussels Sprouts is delicious and very light as for starters. Although I'm a bit disappointed on the Pork Ramen, I think its a little bland. I wish it was a bit spicier or at least more flavors to it. Even though I tried to put some of their sriracha, but still no flavors. I've tried a few ramen places and this isn't the best. I tried some of my younger sister's shaking beef which it was cook perfectly.   Overall is nice and good experience. I would come back to try their rice dishes instead.

photos.caption: Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shaking Beef
Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Brussels Sprouts
Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pork Ramen

k6Mukcvn6n7IU879ATsvpw.text: Great atmosphere, inside/outside seating, modern decor. Even their restroom was impressive! -5 stars   Food: i give it a 4. We ordered the Pork Belly steam bun which was excellent. The Chicken pad thai and XO noodles was flavorful, but just a little too intense.  Overall, great experience!

I4qOxu7AvUmMZy6foWkyEA.text: You have to try Clever Koi and you will be surprised.    the yummy combinations of food  Beautifully crafted drinks  The ambiance is perfect for first dates or a special night . Or just because .. Let's start with the drinks I usually don't drink but this guy seem like he knows his stuff so we went ahead and try "the enabler" and my favorite the "riding the pine" just knowing that has passion fruit I was sold.,  The food was amazing .,

LmroORXwd65Bd4zKghlsIw.text: FOOD: Got the pork belly steamed buns and them galbi short ribs. The pork belly was very juicy and savory. Dat galbi tho was just WAAAAYYYYYY too salty and just tastes TOO different from traditional Korean galbi.  SERVICE: Phenomenal af. They couldn't have done a better job.  VENUE: Parking gone be a breeze and the decor be popping them millennial hipster vibes.   Gotta fix them short ribs if you want them 5 shiny ones. Overall not bad.

photos.caption: Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States. pork belly steamed buns

U_Qb8AGdH-K2eDnF0hABcw.text: I live in the neighborhood and of course eating somewhere in your own neighborhood is always a treat. I went on a weekday during lunch time. Lunch time was probably a mistake, it was fairly busy which affected the service a bit. However, everyone was really nice. The decor in this place is pretty cool, it feels nice enough for a date but also casual enough for yoga pants.   I ordered the katsu sandwich with a side of fries. The katsu sandwich was cut into almost tea sandwich sized pieces which was actually pretty enjoyable. The katsu itself was fried well, the flavor was delicate and not overly greasy. The fries, well they were fries. I also had the pork belly steamed bun. If I could fit 10 of those inside my mouth I would. They were that good. My boyfriend ordered the ramen. It was a huge portion and featured carnitas as well as some of that delicious pork belly. I mention a ton of meat options, but it should be mentioned that the menu also features many vegetarian dishes!

WOGRnPTITcyc8WhZZLVqBw.text: Great place for a date night. It's nice when you find a place whose cool hip atmosphere isn't the only thing that is good about the restaurant. The food was amazing. We loved everything we ordered. It was delicious and creative. The service was top notch. Everyone working was not wasting time and made sure you had quality service and food. I can't wait to come back.

znOWrYvh0sOidtehGYuQUQ.text: Very fun place to eat. Went for lunch and the service was good. Nice decorations. The food was really yummy too! And decently priced. Would definitely recommend the soft shell crab bao, and the Bahn Mi. Large portions so can share a couple plates. Open kitchen style so that's cool to watch. Seems like a fun place to get drinks at night as well!

photos.caption: Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Soft shell crab bao
Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pork Ramen
Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bahn Mi

uGx1AmHwI3bY1tgNU9r3lw.text: Would have gave 4.5 stars if it was an option, but the place itself deserves all 5 stars, my only reason for the thought of 4.5 is that our server was not very personable and seemed a little bothered maybe by the rush.  But through all the rush she was still attentive. Other than that everything from the food to the ambiance was amazing. I will still be back to try again

Lbrd2tZtvE27BcCqTwkqhg.text: Thee absolute best RAMEN in Phoenix !!! No cap Trust me, I literally eat anything I'm well over 350 LBs ... this also might be a cry for help but in realty it's not about  my emotional and physical instabilities it more about this AMAZING place . #ripharambe

photos.caption: Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Patio

Xk8eXLvpA6Ray7-s-t_o8g.text: The food was delicious and so were the drinks. They had a fair amount of veggie/ vegan options too. The drinks were unique and we had plenty of choices. Will visit again on mi next trip to Phoenix.

GbAhW90IqRksIEjXKhZEVQ.text: Sat at the bar this time and much cooler now. Got to see the cook's show up close and converse about the goods they're excited about. Had 3 of the 4 steamed buns - outta dis world!! The *TUNA CHIPS are stupid good! Going to have those all for myself next time.  Definitely can't wait to go back. Mangia!

1NUoN13mAszbGRooWcK2UQ.text: We love this place, delicious unique dishes, wonderful service and a trendy laid back atmosphere. All of these qualities have put clever koi in my top 3 restaurants in the central Phoenix area!

hWrDLiTG5EJnUpT5e9QuNQ.text: I love The Clever Koi.  They have a killer lunch special - a $5.00 bowl of ramen.  After putting all the fancy stuff in it (meat, egg, bok choi, etc) - it comes out to a still-acceptable 10 or 11 bucks. Delicious. Also, the pork belly bun is also excellent.  Every time we've been there, we were greeted warmly by the owner and had good service at the bar. The bartenders are also excellent there. I really like the French 95(?) cocktail - a mix of champagne and whiskey. Weird but mighty good.  They have a good discount on cocktails at happy hour, too.    Hands down, the Clever Koi is great stuff. I go there as often as I can!

photos.caption: Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sitting at the bar. Very competent bar tenders can make you anything. Just ask!

n9v6y_GIyeojmJxGEYQP-Q.text: I went here for lunch today with a coworker. It was about 1:30 when we arrived and they no longer had the bento box special so we built ourselves some noodle bowls for lunch. The process is simple but the server is happy to explain it to you. You pick you noodle or rice and then add your proteins and veggies. They also have some small bites available. We started with the chicken and waffle bun which was delicious. My coworker also had the pork belly steamed bun. I ordered the chow mien with lemongrass chicken and bok choy. My impression was that it was just ok. The whole dish seemed a little salty for my tastes and the bok choy a little bitter. The chicken in my bowl however was spot on. My coworker had ramen noodles with chicken broth, chicken, tofu, all the available veggies and the soft egg. He ate every drop of it so it is safe to assume he enjoyed it. I will definitely go back here and try something else. I hoping to go on a Wednesday for the chicken Katsu bento box.  The service here was excellent, everyone was friendly and extremely efficient. The atmosphere is trendy yet comfortable.   Lunch for two was a bit pricey and ran us almost $45.00 not including the tip.

DxISvw3rdErmo6Zo6POiWA.text: I've been here two times now and both times I have been very impressed with every aspect of the experience.  The service was phenomenal from the waitress to the bussers. The staff is very friendly and they work hard. This was our first time trying the happy hour, and it did not disappoint. We tried the kung pao wings and those were my favorite thing on the happy hour, and only $6.   We also tried the spicy tuna nacho-type appetizer which was good but I wasn't a huge fan of the texture of the rice cracker. The kimchi fried rice with duck was AMAZING. No lie, that's the best fried rice I've ever had. We were able to order everything gluten-free as my wife has recently gone gluten-free.  Overall, this is my favorite Asian Fusion restaurant in Phoenix by far. Keep it up Clever Koi!

N854ZYW7IiOdhY8ZAn8E6w.text: Stopped here after getting my hair cut next door. Took advantage of happy hour and started with drinks. My husband enjoyed the dark and stormy and I had a Pimms cup. I didn't love my pad Thai but would choose something else next time. Was bummed to learn the hard way that they are not open on Sunday but am happy to have this spot nearby. Loved sitting on the patio on a nice evening.

photos.caption: Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States

T6VpfrRZTCKiuTAaf0759w.text: I'm at the Clever Koi at least once a month. It always seems to hit the spot. My favorite is the chow mein with loads of toppings including the kim chi. The shrimp is large and always grilled to perfection. The housemade siracha are delicious. The pig face dumplings are out of this world with the right amount of spicy, salty, and all around flavor. The chicken and waffle bun made my eyes roll in ecstasy. (yes!! It was that good)   The service is always friendly, attentive, and professional.  I love love love this restaurant!!

photos.caption: Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pig face dumplings

u6phaneqJfYByy4LUfDsFA.text: I've been wanting to try Clever Koi in forever and finally decided to go for happy hour. The parking lot is tiny, but looks like there is valet later in the day. The restaurant is next to some type of salon and wine place. We got sat at the patio and I love the decor - trendy, earthy, and very relaxing.   Our waitress wasn't the sweetest by any means, but we made due. We ordered the pork belly and duck steamed buns, the wood fired grill plate with steak, and the shrimp toasts. The pork belly steamed buns were good, the duck was not - way too dry and lacked flavor. The wood fired grill plate took forever to get to our table, but it was just ok. The shrimp toasts were ok too. We were full and had not left much on the plates for a doggie bag.  All in all - I definitely am happy that I came to try it out, but this whole Asian fusion trend is not working for me. Yes, I get the "trendy" ambiance, but I guess I expect what I grew up with at asian restaurants - big portions, lots of flavor and sauce, reasonably priced, and you leave with a doggie bag!

7K1E5h9U8MuTLPjZWa-4mA.text: So I have only recently started posting to Yelp. I was actually here a couple of weeks ago, and if I may borrow from Mel B, this place is "Off The Chain". OMG, the total experience was amazing. The wait staff were knowledgeable, super friendly, and extremely helpful. The food, I had the XO noodles and Bulgogi chicken wings. I must say, some of the best food EVER!!  I tend to be more of a beer and tequila kinda guy, but I told the Mixologist what I like and don't, and he came up some seriously tasty concoctions. Wish I could remember the names (lol). Anyway, great ambience, fantastic serve staff, and awesome food!!

dWEetMyt2dnuTMIo_f7Evg.text: Holy ramen!!!  This place was amazing from start to finish.  Please do yourself a favor and go check it out.  Definitely get the pig face dumping as an appetizer.

bfLtwgiRmPOHgwMVNEpBKQ.text: Well fed and slightly buzzed...  I have given this place three times to disappoint me and they have failed, miserably, all three times. This place just rocks. I have had the seafood pot which was out of this world, the chicken pot which killed it with the jelly, and tonight I found my signature dish and cocktail the kimchi rice bowl with chicken and shrimp with the "word is bond" martini...kicked my ass in flavor, portion, and buzz potential. All thanks to Alexandria with the on point recommendations. This place is a great date night or a cool spot to come chill with that special someone.  You simply must go and go again. #newloyalcustomer

photos.caption: Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yes. To. This.

00zbA31V6GXcl2NJpSzjBA.text: I don't know how to classify the food at Clever Koi... Chinese? Japanese? Dirty knees, look at these? I don't know... but what I do know is that what ever they're doing, they're doing it right.   I first came to CK about a month ago and it nearly, instantaneously became one of my favorite restaurants in PHX.  The Food:   The first thing that stood out were the Steamed Buns. I love steam buns and the ones here are very good. I think I've now tried all of them. The chicken and Waffle as well as the Duck stick out in my mind the most so I would say try those but none have disappointed.   As far as entree's go, I've had the Sweet & Sour (Chicken?) Rice Bowl... I thought I had pork but the menu on their website says it's chicken so whateve's, either way it was delicious.   The next time we came, I had the Mongolian Beef rice Bowl... I think the website menu is wrong because I don't see it on there but I know that's what I got because it was just last night. It was great but what sticks out in my mind is the thin slices of something... some kind of garnish perhaps, but either way this stuff was wriggling like they were alive... it was freaky and kind of cool at the same time. PS... it wasn't alive...   The Dranks:  They make Great cocktails.... The first time I tried the Guns N Rose' because... yeah GNR is the greatest band ever... A nod to CK on the naming... ya got me. It was very good. Not something I'd drink all the time but good.   I think the other drink I got was the Rye & Rum Old Fashioned... again, very good. I could have drank these all night long and then later made very questionable life choices.  They also have a very good craft beer selection. On my second visit I went with the THAT Brewery Road Rash IPA. I like when restaurants have local beer offerings and there were quite a few the night we went.  Let's Wrap it Up:   I didn't mention above but the presentation of the food and drink are very nicely done. Attractive without feeling pretentious. I love that. It's a cool place... the atmosphere is very chill and the service has been excellent both times we've been here.   All that said, I guess it doesn't really matter how you classify Clever Koi. At the end of the day, the only box they fit in for me is the box labeled awesome places to eat and drink in Phoenix. Cheers!

photos.caption: Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken &amp; Waffle &#34;Steamed Buns&#34;
Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sweet &amp; Sour Chicken? Pork? Don&#39;t remember but it was delicious.
