jVZYFsFJOpH78oZIh-I1Cw.text: Fantastic place. Loved the entire meal we had to include excellent pairing with cocktails and wine..

43nDDyu0ypG0LUDTuD5rFQ.text: I have only been once to the Clever Koi but my husband and I can't wait to go back and share this place with friends and visitors to Phoenix!  The food was AMAZING!!  It was so refreshing to go some place like no other!  The atmosphere was very cool and the staff was wonderful.

k6iG7HL0xwQyWEGf6s7Sbw.text: We were very excited to try this place out. They did NOT disappoint. We started out with the great happy hour deals- sampled the ENTIRE list and then moved onto the buns, dumplings and entrees. Highlights-black bean/celery root cakes, chicken and waffle buns, shrimp/scallop dumplings, soft shell crab buns and banana fritters. The owners, Josh and Nick were great resources in helping us choose amongst the many offerings. We will be back!!

sY0YSrbXlXLIzDWuDDNa8g.text: Virtually nothing vegetarian or vegan on the menu. Disappointing. We left. Lots of great options near by. Went to Thai Tiger down the street. Definitely not as swanky but yum and they have great options for veggies. Most places, particularly hip ones, have started to take pride in having great tasting and creative options without meat. Too bad this one doesn't.

-DQpj-cvOJt6XzLxgmjkeg.text: I heard great things about Clever Koi from two friends so I decided to try it out with my boyfriend. We went around 6:30pm on a Friday and sat at the bar as we were told there was about a 20 min. wait for the table. Although, I have to say there were multiple tables available and I don't believe they were for reservations as they were empty the whole time we were there. Anyway... we ordered the duck steamed buns, sweet potato dumplings, duck chow mein, and their special of the night which was yellowtail over rice with black kale and persimmons. The duck steamed buns were really good, but pricey. The sweet potato dumplings reminded me of empanadas as the shell was fried, like a taco kind of way, not a fried dumpling kind of way. However, I really enjoyed them. However, I was very disappointed in my entree. It was super salty. The fish was salty, the kale was salty, even the rice was salty. I tried a bite of the duck chow mein and it was ok, not a huge fan of chow mein anyway so I'm no judge there. For all that, the bill came to about $60. Super disappointed but at least that's another restaurant I can check off of my list. But if you're looking for an asian fusion place, I'd check out SumoMaya, also a little pricey but at least the food's really good!

eoiIePrpN4Ur2wo1XbIB3g.text: EAT HERE!! Nothing like this in Scottsdale. Creative Asian Fusion. Comparable to New York or San Fran quality. We sat at the bar watched these genius chefs work their magic! Awesome service from Andrew, and delicious food! Tuna Chips amazing, Pad Thai super, soft shell crab in coconut curry to die for! For dessert we topped it off with  a salted caramel  ice cream that was Devine!! We def will be back!!

-thGwEI4nYW2OXi9kDITUA.text: Excellent food, very reasonable prices, super great staff from door to table and a fun comfortable atmosphere. I love this place and happily recommend it to anyone I meet. A great place to dine alone at the wok bar ( lots of fun to watch them prepare the food) or with friends at a table. It's even fast at lunch...  Check it out I do believe you will find many delicious choices . One of my favorites is a Kung Pao Brisket. Second favorite is perhaps the Massamon Udon Curry although I have not tried anything I have not liked. The menu offers quite a wide variety  of well thought out dishes and tastes. Clever koi gets my favorite new restaurant vote for sure.

ijtQuvkxUp2ZLEWFtBkOhw.text: exceptionally amazing and unique food. their calamari is a small portion, but they were amazing as well. make a reservation if you don't want to wait in line for more than two people eating dinner. especially on the weekends.

jFCGkvtphG8bRgk93j0BaQ.text: Went here for lunch and was disappointed to find a limited menu, but every bite we had was quite delicious.  Ample parking behind restaurant.  Excellent service.  Loved the kimchi!  Looking forward to trying dinner and some cocktails next time.

-Dh5CnxIEIXP4Qmzi9XHqQ.text: The Clever Koi provided us a delicious culinary journey. The ambiance on the patio was great and the service was prompt and helpful. The food isn't so much Asian fusion as it is just creative and original (for you picky Asian fusion reviewers).  The biggest surprise was the tasty cocktails.

8B-cLuqTswQ5uwtIoUuQ_g.text: This place is my favorite restaurant in Phoenix.  The drinks are always perfectly crafted.  The food is amazing.  So far I have tried the Blood Orange Chicken Wings, Spicy Tuna Chips, Chicken & Waffles steamed bun and Bananas Foster Fritters.  But the standout is the Pork Ramen.  It is THEE BEST bowl of anything in the valley.  The flavors and textures are amazing.  I don't know what my favorite component of this dish is...sometimes it's the egg, other times it's the kimchi and while I'm not a huge pork eater, the pork belly is so good!  Each visit the service was consistent and great.  We even braved the 4th of July crowds during the fireworks and the service was still the same when they were packed as it was during lunch on a Saturday afternoon.

Usf4ALhuVM29D0S0V9Qk1A.text: This was my first trip to the restaurant several of my friends raved about. They were right to rave. I loved the layout; it was open and inviting. Every dish we had was a True reflection of the chef's excellent reputation. I'm really looking forward to going back to explore more of the menu and the awesome drinks. It's a great place to go with a group of friends or for a nice date night out. The prices were reasonable and the food was fresh. We will be back soon.

7W9RzDzv_8UGBe7EeUaB7w.text: WOW a new phoenix hot spot "great atmosphere with quite unique food". Met a friend at who knew about Clever Koi for dinner. We shared  the duck, curry, steamed buns (best), fish dim sum (unreal good), fried rice  and more.  Clever Koi is my go to spot when in central phoenix and hungry. Waitress real nice bar and kitchen staff totally approachable. Had a funny named cocktail fusion drink and knew I would be coming back with sig other to show off my find.. Guess were I'm going tonight after suns game you got it Clever Koi. Also love the patio, custom sign at entrance is welcoming and chandelier over hostess station is sweet touch.. Lucky we are to have choice like this thanks Clever Koi owners and staff.

aIQOG_sGl7cJc2tFMgZl3g.text: I went to Clever Kio on Saturday with my boyfriend. We sat at the bar. I ordered one of their cocktails called the Bees Knees which was a honey lavender gin drink, it was sooooo good I would highly recommend it. My boyfriend and I also got two different type of dumplings to share. He got pig face and I got the chicken ricotta they were both amazing. We also got some steamed buns that were really good. The staff was super friendly including one of the owners who was serving us our drinks behind the bar, Josh. Overall a great experience. Glad my boyfriend went there.

diM4sWEKcFWaA5V1HEDEfQ.text: Visited for the first time last night, and while it's clear that they're still working out some kinks, I really like the direction this place is heading. We really enjoyed the duck steamed buns (although the pork belly could have been a bit more tender) and the pig face dumplings. The ramen was tasty and the broth was unique (although the pork shoulder requires a bit of work) and my gf liked her kimchi fried rice. The cocktails were stellar, particularly for folks like me who enjoy actually tasting the spirits.  Needs a bit of work: Service is still a bit rough (if eager), and they should refine some of the dishes.  Overall, I plan on becoming a regular here, and with a little bit more finesse and experience this becomes a five star spot.

6eWSCQ62mO3eeYp2N3sSsw.text: We just had a wonderful dinner and so enjoyed the ambience of this great restaurant. The food was delicious , the music was great but the best part was the staff, they were not only helpful but we got the feeling that they loved being there, a rare and amazing thing. Now the food , had the pork dumplings, yum! Then the Brussels sprouts , oh boy ! Followed up with kimchi rice, just a perfect dinner. We can't wait to go back!!!!

wGP_id8VaFUbqjlDF4nRGA.text: This review is being wrote after the second time eating at the restaurant. Before I even walked in the restaurant, I loved the little "plaza" that The Clever Koi was in. It is an old existing building that contains two more businesses: Pour, a wine bar lounge and a hair salon. They all work well together.  The businesses all have floor to ceiling windows that face towards the center walk so it is easy to see people that may be joining your party and to create a more open urban feeling. Each time I go, it has been busy so you might want to call ahead and find out if there is a wait. One of my favorite items is the wings. They taste different than "ordinary" wings and it is not so many that you get full before your meal. A good one to share with one or two others. All the food at the table was fresh, flavorful and good portion size. One of my favorite dishes was a noodle dish called Spicy Seafood Hot Pot. It had a nice seafood flavor with a kick. The Clever Koi is classified as Asian-American comfort food and I think you will find it just that.

LZ-ec6kow-xNETrC_o48Uw.text: i love this place. josh makes excellent drinks, $5 build your own lunch bowl and happy hour everyday from 3 - 6. also, mon - wed you can get 2 entree's and 4 beers for $35. (+$5 for liquor drinks)

nLbieqKOxKYHVfXZ6FKDCw.text: The food is excellent and reasonable. We shared a chow mein bowl and a fried rice bowl. All bowls are $5 and then you can add meats and veggies for extra. Sooo good! They have two types of Saracha sauce that are made from scratch. The servers are not bad to look at either and they are really attentive. The place is cool and has a really fun vibe! Highly recommend!

TpaScp8PlHYkgZCsSFcqpA.text: Clever in charging a lot of underwhelming flavors is what I got from my visit.  The crowd is downtown hippsters, who want to be seen. The bar and the drinks were probably the best part of my dining experience.  Staff friendly and helpful.   I watched one of the owners on 3TV mentioned it's not an Asian fusion place..however, the decor is very Asian not the cooks! Very confusing. Regardless Clever Koi is Asian "inspired" however the dishes are not very flavorful, over priced and need salt and other spices.   The ramen was $13 for a little bowl.  The broth is the key.    It tasted like beef broth with a little bit of soy, very tasteless and I would not go again for it.  Kimchi Fried Rice...didn't taste like Kimchi.  The turkey leg..meh.  The buns were the only thing that was "good"  I would only go for the buns and the drinks.  Keep working on your flavors and regardless if it's something new and out of the box, it needs to be tasty and Clever Koi isn't there yet.

tHHXTaQo1k8RlPcBCvdGnA.text: This place is amazing. Hidden gem in Phoenix. Great vibe, staff is great, and food is exceptional! We had the Pork Ramen, and it was unreal. I cant wait to go back.

aIT88yhAB1eQeG5UavGTOA.text: Yeah, super awesome. Buns, noodles, and dumplings solo spot on. Little pricey but pretty classy also.

XHX6Z_7mJv2b_ZAK64km9Q.text: Addiction happens. 5/5 people become addicted to the banana fritters served here. You can't quit them. They are so hot, yummy, so sought after, and perfect that they should be the new bitcoins of foodie culture.  Many have claimed cleverness, to be the best, world-famous, and yet they deceive me. Lies. How dare they.  But here, there is truth. There is yummy. Every. Where.   Grapefruit lemongrass soda - genius Spaghetti and meatballs - fun, fresh, smokey grill goodness with exploding flavor tomatoes Tempura pea ramen - light, refreshing, delicious Banana fritters - they are really the best freakin malasadas humbly under the disguise of "fritters"  If you've eaten too much and decide to skip dessert, then you are not worthy.

OLrHgvVybxrW4zJzvP4rlw.text: Clever Koi is best!!! I've been here once a week for the past couple weeks and I can honestly say it gets better every time. Everything is amazing...ambience, service, food. I recommend sitting at the bar where the chefs are preparing the food rather than a table. What an awesome interactive experience. We order something different every time and I've never had anything that wasn't incredible, both in presentation and taste. I love this place because of how unique and fun the experience is and I leave feeling beyond satisfied. Always a pleasure, already looking forward to next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States. A little something special for dessert :) Thanks Sam!
Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Soooo good!

ff9W_ZF1mwg4YjV5B7vylg.text: Been in here three times now. The service is always good and the food is phenomenal! You can tell the owners really put a lot of work into creating great food and a fun vibe.

photos.caption: Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Seafood noodle dish and a ginger cider! So delicious!

-Zn_RomkTxgiSTPTumcupQ.text: The Clever Koi has some absolutely outstanding dishes (anything with pork belly is delicious!) and some more average appetizers. We eat here at least once a month, especially Monday and Tuesday night (they no longer offer it on Wednesday) since their 'It takes 2' special is an excellent deal. As a bonus they have great outdoor seating.   I recommend their Steam Pork Belly Bun, Kimchi Fried Rice with Pork Belly & Duck Curry.

2G-CZ-SKpV18Y8hnBMwKFw.text: This place is one of the few that I have been to that serves great ramen, along with other amazing menu items.  I had a chicken ramen, with lemon grass broth, the flavor was amazing!  My most recent visit I was accompanied by a friend who happens to be vegetarian, their menu had more than enough options for him which was great!  They also off Gluten-free options. Will definitely continue to stop by!

photos.caption: Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States

uBuqwwJXpRI2X74Cn0zsQA.text: Really fucking good. They were so nice, we couldn't decide so the waiter helped us pick and we ended up loving everything. The waffle chicken is bomb af. So is the ramen and the po boy burger !

AK9IyOdammD_waSxS4NCvg.text: I hover between 3 1/2 stars to 4 stars for this place only because well, prob because I'm Chinese and while I appreciate the decor, atmosphere, and service here the food just seemed a bit tad expensive for what you get.  I mean dumpling with kim chee is a good combination but I don't remember what the price point was. I just remember bear with it- it's the place. I mean for the price, I want a big platter of dumplings and a whole jar of kim chee- not the three or four dumplings that we got!  Same thing with the ramen. I was like, how much for the bowl of noodles??? Okay, okay, I am sure I've been spoiled by Japan town in LA or actual ramens in Japan.  Admittedly, I did enjoy the atmosphere and decor. I think it's a good place to take a date or for a business meeting. And the food is good even if the portions are small.  I guess when I get my Asian on, I want to be belly full with left overs to go!

photos.caption: Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States

keajErOxA1QesouJgrJYeQ.text: Food 6/10 Service 8/10 Value 5/10  Came here with high expectations given the great reviews on Yelp. Came up way short. It's something like fusion Asian cuisine, so Asian ingredients with western flavor. Got the dumplings, fried rice, duck, steak, and some drinks. Underwhelming flavors. Drinks were ok. Came out to be $35 per person. The ambience of the place is nice though. Good to take your date out, but if you're looking for fantastic food and you are familiar with quality Asian food, this is not the place for you

V0t2UbldRtEITRqFWQU0nA.text: First, at 12:30pm, there wasn't a lunch rush. It was busy, but it didn't have that screaming busy hustle that some restaurants get for lunch. I could hear my friend talk and the wait staff was relaxed. Next, parking. There's parking and it's easy and there was plenty of it. Third, you cannot beat build your own ramen. I got the pork broth with tofu (weird I know, I just like it), mushrooms (which were shiitakes, not just button mushrooms), a soft boiled egg, bean sprouts and kim chi. Holy moly! My friend did nearly they identical thing, only she got pork belly and some bamboo too. We didn't talk for a while. The egg was perfect. But my fav was the kim chi. I needed some to munch on as I was eating my ramen. The owner/manager/someone important came over and brought me extra kim chi to take home on top of my side! Like "we don't see people that love kim chi as much as you; please have some more!" Tomorrow, kim chi friend rice. I'm going back, for sure! Great service, great food. I'm really curious what happy hour is like.

photos.caption: Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Hs3ORb_honWJdRionGcNMQ.text: I never thought I liked Gin, but their happy hour drinks are delicious. You must try the Spicy Tuna Chips and the Veal Dumplings!

photos.caption: Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States. This was especially made for me. It&#39;s called Lychi-Li with Titos Vodka. Super Yum!
Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States. I&#39;ve always been against Gin, but the Aviation is fantastic!

Mk2RxaUIUtaowJ0o0N8OZA.text: Nice place to hang out. Too much noise though and it takes time to calm down. Over all its a good place to hang out. Good food and drinks.

78gF1M_NrW03IWKq1LwH0g.text: Excellence in food and customer service!! I love their pork belly steamed buns, the ramen and the dumplings. BUT let me tell you that they are living proof that someone cares about their customers. Uber Eats gave me a very angry driver who called and very curtly exclaims "where are you?!" As his greeting. When he hands me my food, it's only one bag and we had a fairly considerable order, so I let the driver know food was missing after I checked the bag. He gets irritated with me and then tells me I need to call the restaurant. I realized the uber eats guys was just angry at the world so I called the restaurant. They immediately got me to a manager because they had seen the driver had left the rest of the order there. While I'm talking to the manager the uber driver is yelling at me to update my uber request. I explain to the Manager who I learn is one of the owners what is going on with the driver. The owner asked where I lived and drove the rest of the order to my house. You want to support this business - high quality food and service!!

gC1uvs0PKH5X6BZhnY9-fw.text: Oh. My. God. This place needs 10 stars, not 5.  1st time here... and it will not be the last.  My girlfriend, baby, and myself decided to try this out after  looking for a nice ramen place. Based on the excellent reviews, why not? So we decided for a lunch visit.  You do have to park around back, the only thing bad about this place. But it is just a minor inconvenience.   I was greeted by 1 of the four owners, Nick C., and was directed to a table. We were seated and Nick promptly gave us water and ordered drinks. I ordered a hot tea (which I cannot remember what is was called, but it was fantastic), and girlfriend ordered a coke.  My menu for the lunch order was a "build your own bowl". I decided on a Ramen Noodle bowl, with pork broth. I chose the pork belly as the protein with carrots/mushrooms/bok choy as the vegetables. The extras I added were the eggs and kimchi. Too good. Mouth watering, like heaven having a party in my mouth. I honestly cannot wait until I come here again.   The girlfriend ordered a pork chow mein which wasn't too bad. She preferred my ramen over her chow mein, but hers was still tasty.   Due to this being a trendy, hip place I did see a lot of different drinks and such which I hope to experience one day.

F9c-2MBS9gV_a8C_OoE85Q.text: Today is my 30th birthday and since it's a milestone, I decided to Yelp locally and find a new place. I read the reviews and saw they were positive so I happened to decide that this is where I'd like to spend my 30th birthday.  I got all in my finest attire and stepped on out to the world. The ambience is great and more dressy than casual which is exactly what I was looking for. The alcohol that adorned the wall behind that bar was vast as well. We were greeted immediately upon entering and were seating promptly. My sister and I took advantage of the "2" deal which was two meals and four cocktails for $30.  Beyond a great deal IMO. We had two cocktails each and appetizers to start.  I had the curry and my sister had the salmon bibimbap.  Everything was beyond delicious. My food actually had spice to it too which I appreciate as I fancy spicy foods.  We were also given complimentary peach fritters for my birthday for dessert which were phenomenal. Service 5 star Ambience 5 star  Food 5 star Overall you guessed it, 5 star Highly recommended and I'll visit again

photos.caption: Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Peach Fritters for my bday
Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My sister&#39;s and my dinner for my 30th birthday.

zEasunLJh-9j3nxsoOyaiQ.text: The Clever Koi literally is as good as it gets.  Bar program, service, food, ambiance, happy hour, location all on point.  These guys are doing it right and have created easily one of the best spots in PHX.  If you've been on the fence about a visit, go ahead and hop off the fence and get in here.  Look out Gilbert, the second location in downtown Gilbert is going to take the food scene out there to the next level.

nOLTfufxy8eIjxjWJeqEXw.text: The Clever Koi is it. The True 5 star restaurant. My husband and I have been here twice and we both agree it is truly our favorite restaurant in the Valley.  Location is awesome. While parking is not the best (most spaces are "reserved" for George and Dragon patrons only), we always have managed to find a spot fairly easily. If not, they always have valet available.   Ambiance is fantastic. Love how it's decorated, the interior design and lighting are great.  Service? Some of the best I've ever experienced. David has been our server both times and I cannot say enough wonderful things about him. He's so friendly, attentive, and incredibly knowledgeable about not only the food menu, but the drinks as well. He can explain every single ingredient of the drink menu to you, from chartreuse to Pimm's to anything else you may not know. If I've had a sweeter, more genuine server, I cannot remember when it was. He remembered us from our first foray in and made sure to say goodnight to us as we left (and let us know the new menu would be coming out soon, yes!). The general manager (who has been there both times we have) is always super friendly as well, running food and always making sure everyone's happy. The bussers are great too (waters were always kept full) and the place runs like a well oiled machine.  Drinks were awesome. My husband ordered one that ended up being fairly strong, so David came by and did a few revisions to it, making it absolutely delicious. I had the Temperance Trap (awesome), one of my girlfriends had the Paloma (also awesome), and another friend had the homemade Green Apple soda (a special for the night), which he loved.  Okay, so now onto the food.  Ohhhh, the food.  Blue Lake Green Beans. Every person at the table said the same thing (both times): "how can you make green beans taste THIS good?" Answer from David: the woodfire grill, of course. Apparently in the winter there are brussel sprouts instead of green beans, so I can't wait for it to get chilly again!  Things I didn't eat but was told were amazing: the chicken and waffles and  pork belly steamed buns, pork ramen, chicken ramen, and chicken chow mein. All six of us last night were "mmmm"ing through the meal.   Both times, I've ordered the vegetable chow mein with tofu. So. So. So good. The tofu is cooked on the woodfire grill, the vegetables (especially the mushrooms) are marinated in some blend of spices that are so delicious that one of my fellow diners had to try some out of another's bowl.   For dessert... well, we went a bit dessert crazy. David let us know there were a few new desserts: a chocolate pudding with a cashew nougat and a citrus soft serve, in addition to the bananas foster fritters. It was my husband's birthday so we thought "what the hell" and ordered all three. And I am so glad we did, because they were all delicious.   Throughout the meal David came by to ask us how everything was, to chit chat with us and make sure we knew he was available. We absolutely loved talking with him and appreciated so much that we knew he wasn't too busy for us (even though he was definitely busy!).   I can't say enough good things about Clever Koi. Now I can't wait for the new menu to come out, so we have another excuse to go visit!

bnnEPWA6G0fwYJG8dg_5eQ.text: Don't call "black bean patties" pancakes because it's a big misconception. Besides that it does give a cool Austin vibe. Food is alright, music is passive, staff is collected.

VxQxRTmkiVqz2uuaqhrAjw.text: What isn't great about this place, really? I've been here 3 times now and I have yet to be disappointed. The food is delicious, they have a wooden grill inside that you can observe them cooking on. The specials of the day are so great, but they go fast!   There are so many different routes to go down to experience the flavors of their menus, so I recommend going with some friends so you can try a little bit of everything!

aKimWX9Pq1TLZc2Cre_-kA.text: My friend and I decided to hit up Clever Koi on a random weekday night in an attempt to actually explore our surroundings. We had a bit of trouble finding it since it is tucked away from the road, but we finally found the right parking area after we looped around once. We had made reservations since we were worried about a possible crowd and a table was ready for us when we got in. We were seated quickly and definitely had a moment of "oh god what should I order because everything sounds good." The menu had gyoza, buns, noodles, ramen, etc.  My friend was super interested in the rabbit gyoza while I was drawn to the black bean and celery root cakes. My friend enjoyed the gyoza and we both liked the black bean and celery root cakes but agreed that they would have been better with either less wasabi, or perhaps wasabi on the side rather than directly on top. For our main dishes, we grabbed the pork ramen and the pad thai with tofu. My friend loved the pork ramen and I thought the pad thai was good, though a bit on the sweeter side than I like. I also felt that $3.00 was a bit of an excessive charge for adding tofu to the pad thai, particularly because it literally came with 3 large pieces of tofu only. Though I was a bit irked by the tofu portion, the pad thai portion was ginormous. I could not finish it in one sitting and definitely had to take some to go. One thing I really loved about this place was that they had their own little hot sauces that you can use to spice up your food. I'm a spicy/flavorful food junkie so this was right up my sleeve.   Clever Koi lived up to my expectations overall. It had great service, good food, a very chill atmosphere, and an interesting interior + patio seating. I am definitely going back to try their other menu items such as chow mein and vegetarian ramen! *I may also be super curious about their interesting list of cocktails.*

photos.caption: Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pad thai with tofu!

7VYOB7vN1W4EfvTX3Vfd8w.text: Good neighborhood joint. This is no burger joint. It's upscale and trendy. The Asian buns were ok, not wow! The pork ramen soup was not as hot as it should be and the taste was again, ok. The drinks were tasty, but on the expensive side. This place would be a good spot to catch up with friends, but the food definitely was not something I would come back for.

M1xzYyG2RZbdgF_HqkEbkA.text: What a find!!! Visiting Phoenix for business and to see family. Went to my "go to" Yelp to find a high-rated restaurant for dinner near our hotel. Oh course, several popped up, but Clever Koi had what we were looking for in a meal. Service was excellent (shout out to RaeAnne) as she gave us a nice rundown of drinks and her favorite dishes. Being somewhat ADHD myself, squirrel, I did not pay attention to all of the suggestions. My wife however did. My wife ordered the XO Noodles and I could not believe all of the flavors that hit you from that dish - one of the best dishes I have tasted!!! Sous Chef Luis, incredible job! This place is a must when visiting Phoenix. Loved it so much, I would even brave the heat of summer to eat here again!!!

XNz4EXeM_TKDJ9rb9hiZ7A.text: The food was delicious - plain and simple. The drinks were reasonably priced and well made, can't go wrong there. It has a great ambiance and the staff were super nice, responsive, and helpful. They have a deal to get 2 bowls and 4 drinks which is a great deal to share - highly recommend doing this! All of the food was fantastic and if you check in sometimes there's a deal for a free bun which is totes worth it!!!

fnOsuHtr88fYjl8sDBDhAQ.text: Let me start off by saying that I really like this place, the food is good and service is usually too. I've been here a couple of times and never had any complaints. However, yesterday I had dinner with 3 friends, we all had a couple of drinks and food. The staff seemed in a hurry to get us out of there, clearing the table while we were still enjoying our drinks, not much later the "off-day" manager came over and asked us to leave. It didn't feel good, we went back to talk to her and she offered a 10% discount for our next visit, however I'm not sure I'll be back any time soon..

7q407d0xqHW7XJvCqMlcYA.text: Ordered takeout and it was above expectation! The ramen was delicious despite that it had been soaked in the soup for however long time it took for delivery. The duck curry is spicy and tasty. I loved it so much.

aavBKbGP6Bn9_SJE5a6sLw.text: We came for an early dinner and ordered orange glazed chicken wings, black bean pancakes and 3 kinds of buns.  The chicken wings were an absolute epic FAIL.  Soggy breading and flavorless meat.  Basically inedible.  The waitress noticed we only ate 3 of the 6 per order and yet didn't offer to change the order.  The black bean "pancakes" were kinda like veggie burgers, much thicker than expected.  Though they were tasty, I would probably never order them again.  The 2nd extra star is for the delicious soft shell crab bun which came with a jicama slaw dressing.  The chicken and waffle "bun" might have been a good idea conceptually but didn't come thru in execution.  Not enough syrup and crispy chicken was over cooked.   I wouldn't come back here again.

5Ndi-0e7MqBmJz5-7SQL3A.text: So darn hip. So darn good. So darn clever. Clever koi has been my go to for ramen. The lemon pepper chicken ramen will never disappoint. Nor will the steamed pork bun as an appetizer. The noodles in the ramen mixed with the crunchiness of the vegetables and the sweetness of the lemon in the chicken is to die for.   Today, I decided to switch it up and go with the kimchi fried rice with the lemongrass chicken and it was just okay. The egg and chicken were done really well but there was a lot of spices and seasoning and it would have paired well with a sauce of some kind to offset how dry the seasoning made it. Overall, 7/10.   I will always return and I will never stray from lemon pepper chicken ramen again. Stay clever, friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Kimchi fried rice with lemongrass chicken

nwfz-WAFsDo9-az7bkfe0Q.text: The food was what drew us here and it was beyond what we were anticipating.  Great flavors and ingredients.  If you are a foodie make this a stop soon.  Service and atmosphere were great as well.  Can't wait to go back

sy746Fcg4fbDVErHJ657mw.text: I love love love this place! The modern decor and the friendly staff mixed with the awesome food makes this a great restaurant. Hands down this is my favorite places to get a bowl ramen. I've had the pork ramen and vegetable ramen and both are so flavorful and appetizing. I can't forget about the pork belly and chicken/waffle buns, both are a must when visiting this restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ORcjFWPLdYf6LOnpxnhYTA.text: Tasteless, bland hipster food.  Ramen is absolutely bland, the broth tastes like water. Siumai presentation is a 10/10 until you bite into it and quickly realize it's dry and flavorless.  If you like flavorless, bland food that offers great presentation this is the place to be.

bnw44GIrp7fX5FuNyGjvaw.text: We had a great meal here...only downside was a bit slow service ...but the food is the bomb! Best soft shell crab ever...great fried calamari...ramen noodles w pork/chicken...veggie noodles...great cocktails...definitely worth the trip...

F0Zp70eKTOK0uWwaicHldg.text: Right off the bat I can tell you the service is excellent. Consistently. From when seated at the bar or the table or outside they crush it in the service department all day err day ! Its nestled away next to the wine bar and salon and is intimate and warm inside. The outdoor seating is ok as long as it isnt a 100 .. Phoenix, right ? :)   The cocktails are delish, and i cannot thank the bartenders enough. They make beautiful cocktails crafted for you after they take the time to talk to you and know you and  honestly it is refreshing they do. I mean it wasn't a slow nigh by any means when i have been here but they are always engaging and friendly. Cannot appreciate it enough   The food was great, plenty of vegetarian options and I have never left the place anything less than completely satiated. From ramen to black rice and to random drinks clever koi is always a hit.

I1tZx6_DFjAim4kP6m7pQQ.text: Clever Koi exceeded my expectations! We made a reservation at 6:30 for 6 people on a Saturday night, and it was promptly ready as soon as our party arrived. Their drink selection was original, and our server provided great recommendations.   The pork belly steam bun was absolutely sensational, I think when I go back I am going to order a bunch of them as a meal! I also had the dumplings, which we're spicy and had a very traditional feel. For an entree we got the fried chicken and it was lovely, the sauce that comes with it is delicious.   They asked if we were celebrating anything, and we let the know that we had gotten engaged the day before and they brought out a fried banana ball (I have no idea what it's called) for each person in our party!  They made our experience lovely, and I'll certainly be back!

Ed5r2dYXzBRQ37fdaOWlXg.text: Drinks were incredible! Soft shell crab steamed bun amazing! Bahn me was not great. Bread did not taste fresh and the carnitas weren't very good. Overall great experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States

_nKWqPxQ_1-nAqqHag7niQ.text: My friends and I flew into Phoenix and all we wanted was pool time and delicious food and drinks. We didn't find Clever Koi until our last night and it was definitely the best part of our trip. From the food, to the staff, the atmosphere... this place hits the nail on the head. I mean seriously, what a beautiful space!   I ordered the Uptown (drink) and was not only impressed with how descriptive the bartender was in helping me choose it, but also how ridiculously smooth it was. I mean seriously, if you're reading this and dig a little gin, get the Uptown.   We were seated swiftly and had such a first-rate dinner, both of our servers were amazing, accommodating, and so kind (seriously, give them a raise they were the best). Shout out to Zach + Nick for being great sports when we forced them outside to help us take a group photo! Just know we were deeply impressed with every bit of our experience at Clever - even beyond the food, you have orchestrated a beautiful team and place to dine, you should be proud.  Keep up the hard work, it's paying off!

VMCfuhWY1uy2IbUHErWqrg.text: I use to come here once or twice a week for their pork ramen because it was so good. This was about a year or so ago when I worked close by. Today I worked from home and thought oh ya.. let's do this. What a disappointment. I am so sad because I loved their ramen broth, noodles, pork belly, egg and service. I know they opened a shop in Gilbert and thought maybe the owners were putting their time and effort there. Please owners do quality control on the Phoenix location. I have told so many people to come here because it was legit.. now I am regretting that.

D2wEtzaCzgY_Bv5xp6icdg.text: I live a block away from this restaurant, that frequent and love going to for the chow mein.  So today I went there thinking I would treat myself to a working lunch and enjoy a glass or two of wine and some chow mein.  The young man behind the bar was clearly not there to help service the paying customers and clearly has no business working in ANY public service establishment since he clearly is unaware that the patrons that enter your establishment are the ones that pay his bills.  I sat down at the bar as I usually do and was approached by the young man who seemed less than enthused to be there, I ordered a glass of wine which he promptly brought to me and then he walked away.  Now having been a restaurant owner myself I am usually fairly patient with issues that can arise, misunderstandings of a certain nature, young people who are just lacking experience.....I get it!  However, as you will be able to see form the camera footage in your establishment I sat and waited for over 20 minutes with only two other patrons inside the restaurant before I finally had had enough of being flat out ignored and I walked out and intend to never return.  Meanwhile this young bartender/waiter, whatever he was never ONCE spoke another word other than taking my beverage order to me, and in fact walked up to where I was sitting three times in nearly half hour that I was there an never asked if I wanted anything to eat, never mind that I had looked at the menu at least half a dozen times waiting to have my order taken.  I would suggest Mr. Campisano that you do a better job of assessing your talent and in fact find people who actually possess the talent of working in the service industry and who want to be there.  As well some proper coaching of the responsibilities of the job with your team is MUCH needed as this specific individual spent more time off the floor and running back and forth from "Across the Pond" rather than tending to the patrons that were sitting at his bar.  Shameful and completely lacking any concept off customer awareness and appreciation for those that CHOOSE to spend there money there.  LEARN THE BASICS....THE CUSTOMER PAYS THE BILLS!!!

fiBvjyHWAOFTpyczzTRUxw.text: Shocked I hadn't already reviewed them! This is easily one of my favorite local restaurants! I hate to use the word, "hip" because I know it sounds corny, but they pretty much are! Decor is great, food is even better! I usually order the Kimchi Fried Rice + extra kimchi, & then of course I sample whatever anyone else at my table has ordered. I think this is more a place for the adventurous diners. If you're expecting authentic Asian food, this is not it. If you want a flavorful, unique dish that pulls from different cultures, look no further! The staff are friendly & chill, & usually quite attractive! They tend to be consistently busy & don't have a ton of space so I highly recommend making a reservation, even for dinner during the week it's helpful.

photos.caption: Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pineapple Upside Down Cake
Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My Yelp boyfriend!
Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Banana Fritters + Oreo Pudding

ei26dgFFogJ-T8R3QUbFtw.text: Hands down one of the best restaurants in greater PHX area. Bit of a drive from Scottsdale but I may as well get used to it because it's gonna be a regular of ours. Cool building as you approach with a super cool patio, inside is super chill and well decorated with neat light fixtures, clean bathrooms which is a must. On to the food. Andrew was very helpful in our decisions being that everything sounded great. Pad Thai, best ever, house salad best ever, Brussel sprouts best ever, fried black rice with shrimp was awesome! Start with the Tuna rice chips. WOW! No room for deserts, can't wait to go and try the mixologist cocktails. Can't wait to back period. Pictured is Kimchi fried rice we got to go knowing that we'd be craving to try one more thing next day. Can't say enough good things about this place. Goooo!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States

7WkDjM4dJh4M-j53jJxKIQ.text: Go here if you are in Phoenix. One of the best ramen I've had. We tried Lemon Chicken Ramen Soup and XO Noodles. Both were super delicious. Try there soft bun fusion recipes, too good. Banana fritters + caramel for dessert, something you must try.

rbbNXhim0_WUXiFeCVEpoA.text: Went with a friend for my birthday today.  Had the Soft Shell Crap steamed bun, XO noodles (YUMMMMOOOO) Chopped salad w/Tofu (I have never tasted more delicious Tofu in my life). Coconut Ice cream for dessert (again, the best coconut ice cream I ever had).  Just love the chill vibe and amazing service.  Our waiter was fantastic.  Will be back again.  You should not hesitate to go here.  You will love it.

6qUZxSqErm5BpMpZ8EiEfA.text: My favorite spot ever!! Amazing dishes and cocktails! Must get here are pig ear dumplings ( a bit spicy) , tuna chips(very refreshing), lemon pepper chicken ramen, crispy pinnaple duck , XO noodles, pork belly buns! I always get a spicy cucumber cocktail and they always do a great job. I come here every other week. So good!!

Q_dj4-20dM9QPuXE17cRzg.text: This is a super cute place. It seems hard to get to, because you have to go in between the next restaurant. The wait staff was amazing and so attentive. I loved how they told us about their specials, as well as, their personal recommendations. I can't say this enough, "the calamari fries are amazing!," and I will go back everytime just for these! The Ramen was to die for.

photos.caption: Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States

9xh9zLAjs7RUsND0mP0XGA.text: Good quality Asian food.  The duck curry was a little disappointing.   The sauce was a pretty good red curry sauce but the other ingredients were laid on top which made the curry ingredients taste disconnected.  Something happens in a curry when you cook the ingredients in the sauce.  This quality was lacking in this dish.   The soft shell crab bun though was excellent.  Will definitely come back here and try other parts of the menu

hmHLQnMPMe6hsmvbw7tGOA.text: We decided to try Clever Koi for dinner (7:30pm). Wait time for my wife and I was about 30 minutes, about what we expected. Place was packed and very noisy but a cool atmosphere. A table wasn't available so we took 2 chairs at the Kitchen bar. It actually turned out to be a cool spot to sit. We got to watch the staff prepare dishes. Impressed how they worked as a team and were very efficient. Plus we could scope out what they had to offer for food.   We started with the chicken & waffle and soft shell crab buns. The chicken and waffle was ok, nothing special IMO. But the soft shell crab bun was amazing!! I checked in on the Yelp app and got a free bun of my choice. I obviously got another soft shell crab bun haha. I had 2 beers (Dragoon IPA and some type of red ale), both were on tap and were pretty good.  Our main dishes were the Lemon Grass Chicken Ramen with added Duck and soft egg. The ramen noodles had a little chew to them and were excellent. Broth, chicken, duck, egg and veggies were all very good, 5/5. My wife ordered the Pad Thai with Duck. Could have used a little more sauce but it was still pretty good 4/5.   Overall a great atmosphere, friendly staff, great food but very noisy. When we're back in Phoenix we'll definitely hit up Clever Koi again.

photos.caption: Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States. We sat at the Kitchen bar
Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lemon Pepper Chicken Ramen with added duck and soft egg 5/5
Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States. House Pad Thai with duck 4/5

WRsJw3tCkNFpJRMFZG_pDQ.text: Just meh. Overall underwhelmed and disappointed by this place. I think this is the first time I have attended a 4.5 star yelp joint with almost 1,000 reviews, to not give it at least a 4 myself. Bummer.   The atmosphere in here was very aesthetically pleasing. Great for pics and 'grams of food, if that's your thing. However, the food and the service were really lacking. I went with a group of 5. We got the dumplings, pad Thai, pork ramen, and shaking beef. The best thing we ordered was the dumplings.   Pad Thai- this dish had the perfect amount of spice, but didn't have any special components or wow factor. Definitely not worth the price, especially once you add a protein.  Pork ramen- also kind of flavorless. The pork belly was pretty tough...... I understand it was meant to be crunchy, however I expected a soft inside like typical pork belly. It was just a hard block.  Shaking beef- too much rice, flavor also meh. The beef was pretty hard and charred. It also came out cold which I don't know if it was supposed to but wasn't a fan of.   Cocktails were expensive and took about ten years to arrive to our table. I would consider them good, not great, and I don't think the price was justified for what you actually got.   The servers were really nice but everything took sooooooo longggggggggg. We didn't even get our first drinks until after our appetizer arrived. We ordered a second drink shortly after our food arrived, only to receive it right when the bill was coming to the table and we no longer had food. They did comp this drink though- which was much appreciated. The wait for the appetizer itself was longer than normal, and time between different plates arriving wasn't timed well.   Overall not impressed and won't be back, unless invited for a work dinner or something. There are way better places in Phoenix to dine - and a bomb a** Thai joint (Glai Baan) where your money will be better spent.

aHOeUmYCozYDxS3mPFscmQ.text: I'm sad to leave this review but I don't think I'll ever  dine here again.  To be fair I've had excellent customer service in the past but was actually embarrassed about the poor customer service.   I wanted to try dishes I've never tried before but uncertain of the size or appetite, I asked to hold onto a menu. My girl friend ordered her main dish after a small appetizer and I ordered mushroom dumplings. My girlfriend got her dish, I didn't want hers to get cold, so I told her to start. I couldn't get our waiters attention for the life of me. The order was never placed. It took almost an hour to get and in the meantime, my friends plate and been cleared and I was still waiting. Another server stopped by and wanted to take menu. I explained that I hadn't receive dumplings and I would like to hold onto a menu. He checked on order and said it would be up any moment now, then replaced menu on table and told me not to use it as a placemat but I was just seeing what else I would want that wouldn't take long. After getting the dumplings an hr after ordering I was done. Still not trying to make a big deal we ordered desert (ice cream) figuring it wouldn't take long but that wasn't the case. Staff was negligent and rude. I get that they were busy but the entire experience was sad.

1wMuuqFI5AZhqsh4TELR3g.text: I'm not kidding when I tell you those pork buns are to die for!!! I usually ask for recommendations from the waitress, and I could not go wrong with what she said she liked from the menu! My drink was "the ENABLER" so good!! For dinner it was the chow mein!

photos.caption: Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States

djVpkVvxfp7aqsgPvYZxZQ.text: Our lunch was superb! We had the ramen with pork and it was definitely worth the trip. We also enjoyed our pork bun very much. I liked the ambiance, the cleanliness and the professionalism that we saw and encountered. Loved this restaurant.

HWuf3W5h3EB79ZlY5hpbMw.text: Ramen pork Belly here is really good and I like the creative menu. I tried the soft shell crab bun, the Short Rib dumpling, and ramen pork belly. The soft shell crab bun was tasty but the Short Rib dumpling was a bit bland for my taste.

photos.caption: Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Short Rib Dumpling
Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Soft shell crab bun
Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pork Belly Ramen

KmO1pQiMAYyNA-MD5m1fVQ.text: We really enjoyed our first experience. I would give 4.5 stars but I'll side with 5. I would have liked to have seen some pictures only because we are not familiar with all the terms and feel of some of the dishes. We ordered the scorpion bowl and it was epic as well. The drinks are off the chart and I don't order this BS drinks but I think the bartenders are professionals. I can't wait to come back and try more

zqHMSkxOKXPMLAvDJd28RA.text: We are fully aware that our bunch is more than a lot to handle at times but our server, Jason, and the rest of the staff rose to the occasion to say the least. Outstanding food. Outstanding service. Outstanding time.

JrCPNLGmku1v56cUn-9ZzQ.text: Been here a few times. The menu looks very good, execution is another story. I have always experienced service that was unfriendly.  Ordered the dumplings yesterday and they came served on top of cold kimchi so the dumplings were cold. I asked the bartender if they were meant to be served cold and he said no and took them away.  When he returned with the next batch they were prepared the same way and cold. I suggested that they might consider keeping the kimchi on one side of the plate and the warm dumplings on the other. He rolled his eyes and walked away. Hire real servers, not hipsters that feel they are above doing the job. Waste of time, better Asian opportunities out there.

zzCe0E3qIxZEhmwhKNLkew.text: Another delightful meal here this evening. I think this is one my favorite restaurants in the valley. It is so unique, quaint and everything I try is full of flavor.   Last time we went, we sat in the kitchen bar where we got to see all of the food being prepared. It was like dinner and a show. Well people kept ordering the cauliflower dip. This is something I probably would have never thought to order but watching them make it made me want to try it so we did tonight. It was so tasty. It was a bit spicy but the sweet onions on top balanced it out perfectly. We tried the short rib dumplings. They were amazing. The broth they are in is so good. I loved the pork ramen last time so I had to have it again. Delicious. My husband had the Arizona Ramen. That was slightly spicy but full of flavor.

pIHW2bEo6OAcvrpvB-GoWw.text: Paid this place a visit as it has been on my watch list on yelp. Food was good overall, the only downside to it was each food item came one at a time and left the stomach mourning for the next entree to come out. Fresh ingredients, appropriate portion sizes, but pricing was a bit much for each item. In reality, your paying for the ambience and quality of foods served. I would definitely give place another shot.

SoJM65pBqyR4PYTYCWKjRg.text: Surprisingly delicious fusion restaurant.  A coworker and I were taking a class nearby and decided to have lunch here. I got the ramen bowl with chicken and was quite delighted. It was more than I could eat for lunch and I wanted to take it with me. The dining room is a little small but the food is A+.

6BdOk9wWIVsLJjJCz_TyRw.text: Went here today for late lunch. Happily they were open, unlike some other places around here (cough Nishikawa.)   I started with the pork cheek dumplings. The dumplings were stellar. They were crispy on the bottom and soft and juicy on the top, perfect. I meant to ask if they made the Kimchi in house, but on reflection I'm sure they do. I love Kimchi and learned to make it Japan and Korea. Now maybe I'm just a traditionalist, but I think their Kimchi could have used more garlic, definitely more Gochugaru, and time. Time allows the fermentation process to give an effervescence to the Kimchi, and this one barely had that quality. The little sweet red peppers don't belong in Kimchi or this dish. I would replace them with a few salty edamame to help season the dish.   As I had been denied Ramen just minutes before, (cough Nishikawa) I next had the pork ramen. First, it was gigantic. I'm a pretty big eater but I only got through half of it. The crispy pork belly was spectacular. I will definitely be back to try the steamed buns with pork belly. I love nori so that was a nice addition, and the egg was perfectly cooked. I didn't notice any cilantro in the dish even though it's listed on the menu, but I wasn't bothered by that. After thinking about that for a moment though maybe the absence of cilantro made the Carnitas not make sense. I thought that it didn't need to be there and it was somewhat out of place in this dish.  But, the heart and soul of a good ramen is the broth. This broth was good, and I would happily drink a hot cup of it for breakfast. But still, it was only good and didn't rise above that. For the chefs, if you want to experience something you can measure your broth against head to Pasadena to a place called Tatsunoya. It's worth the drive, it's even worth the walk. When you get there there's going to be a line around the building and you'll have to wait about an hour for a table, but it's worth it.   I will definitely be back as there are many items on the menu I want to try. Thank you for a great lunch.   I also ordered XO noodles to go because I wanted to try something that was prepared in that fantastically flaming hot wok. Those will have to wait until tomorrow because I'm still full from my late lunch.

YX9Xc7jZDe-mzh0bgaeCfQ.text: Its been a while but it popped up and I remember having the chicken and waffle tacos and absolutely adoring them. Thanks, looking forward to my next visit

GV-59dNliEa35Y_6b4U-KQ.text: This was my first time trying this place out and I was very impressed. The food was delicious I had the chicken katsu and a pork belly bun I hadn't eaten that day since lunch so I was very hungry both hit the spot. I also ordered an Old Fashion that was just right along with pimm's cup as my second drink both equally great got to love a place that can make amazing cocktails.

KVoT2NnxbLmSy3eQtK9yQA.text: I had the pad Thai while hubby had the gabli ribs :) really good! Service was quick, clean, and attentive. Overall a very good experience, highly recommend!

EY4-lai9Uc761z7SISNpMA.text: Best ramen/ambience combination in Phoenix. Incredibly creative cocktails. Go for the Monday/Tuesday special to get 2 bowls of ramen and drinks for $45.

ylecnp6SuzY6NsGNfB0oFw.text: Best ramen in town! And the xo noodles are super good too. This place has my favorite happy hour--it runs until 6 and has a ton of food and drink options. The music is always great and the staff is really helpful too. Worth the price!

sWj8kbBZubZvHHmUVe0uuQ.text: Veggie steam buns were good, but the dipping sauce made the dish flavorful. The veggie ramen was too salty and I felt like it was something I can make out of a ready-made ramen box at home. Overall, I didn't think it was vegetarian friendly considering there were probably three items I could order off the main course menu.

Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States

uYvufm7uHjnXAcfxltjPaQ.text: Overall: Great place to try something new. I had been eyeing this place for years and I finally got to try it.   Food: Great food. Everything tasted fresh. Ordered the fried calamari and the spicy hot pot seafood noodle. Recommend yelpers to try if you like spicy and seafood.   Service: Very attentive. They made sure we had everything and they even gave us some bowls if we wanted to share our meal.   Price: The price for our meals were decent for what I ordered. The udon noodles in my soup tasted very fresh. And I didn't expect to get some really nice seared of calamari on top.

photos.caption: Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fried Calamari
Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Spicy hot pot seafood soup. Delicious yum if you like spicy and seafood! The udon noodles were fresh too!

7rD_oZxQ9YVoXDxxcaQjGA.text: I came here several times years ago. I always loved the ambiance and the cocktails particularly. The menu was interesting but no matter what I tried the food seemed to fall short in terms of taste. I stopped coming here for a long time.   Recently our friend suggested that a group of us go. I saw the ratings had gone up so I thought I would try it again. The food did taste a lot better. Between the three of us we had the ramen, brussel sprouts, dan dan noodles, various baos, and pineapple duck.   Unfortunately shortly after leaving we all go sick to varying extents. Two of us threw up and I had a bad stomach ache all night. We are all accustomed to asian food and eclectic menus so I strongly believe there was something contaminated in the food. For that alone I would have to give 1 star. Highly disappointed, I can't seem to get it right with this place.

7k2DdW4alz02tdUIgM8FUQ.text: Their pork belly steam buns are awesome, and I totally fell in love with the spicy seafood ramen. Perfectly cooked udon and a delicious broth. I have a cilantro allergy so i couldn't have it with the ramen but it was awesome without it! Our server (I wish I remembered his name) totally matched our general goofy demeanors and was very attentive. He also recommended the ramen to me which of course I loved. I didn't have any of their happy hour stuff but the deals were great and their cocktails sounded amazing. The atmostphere out on the patio is really peaceful and feels quite nice even when it's pretty hot out, given all the shade from their beautiful plants. Definitely will be coming back soon to try more of their stuff.

photos.caption: Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States. patio heaters

OWXqgMSyktHzz76-IuXkBg.text: They did not serve us even we checked bebore 5 pm. They said they served themselves after 9pm. A very disappointed customer.

photos.caption: Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States

0yKyyIhRUU32U9Vns0YqMw.text: Clever koi does have good food, sometimes. For me it's always been hit or miss and totally depends on what you order. I would avoid the pad thai and go straight for the steam buns. I love the soft shell crab bun. Another disappointment is the service. It's usually super slow and it takes forever to get a drink, even if it's a beer.

KftaSec-HicdDMJdYnKMDA.text: Ordered chicken noodles. About 2 of the 7 listed ingredients came. Management said that was how it's made. Well then your menu is a farce.

92Y-S5rwM6HdfDNOVkDIdQ.text: Pretty strange that I haven't reviewed Clever Koi yet. I have been here a handful of times and they usually always deliver with bold flavors and great cocktails. The only disappointments that I have really experienced here are with the desserts. We have tried their desserts on a few occasions and both times we were not fans. However, they have an awesome happy hour menu and the cocktails are some of the best in the valley. Overall a really cool spot to get some happy hour grub. I recommend the bahn mi and the burger for happy hour.

jbutyv6dDa6M5qCRsLt-Ug.text: Best calamari I have ever had in my life. The staff was so attentive, informative, and friendly. I can't wait to try different dishes. It smells amazing in there. Really cool clean environment.

Y9h5u5kFglYX8hN9THRlSw.text: Living off of Central and Thomas puts you right in the middle of some very awesome food choices. One of our favorites has been Clever Koi, as it is truly unique with its asian fusion.   My favorite appetizer has been the duck fat sriracha wings which are absolutely phenomenal! We have also enjoyed the galbi short ribs and the black bean pancakes (so good!). As for the entrees, I really enjoy the spicy seafood hot pot, which has an awesome mix of seafood including calamari and scallops. I have also gotten all of the different Steamed buns, and if I had to pick a favorite it would definitely be the soft shelled crab steamed bun.   They also have some good signature cocktails and my fiancee enjoys a gin based cocktail that I'm struggling to recall the name of. I am happy with the beer offerings that they have.   We never leave Clever Koi disappointed and have even ordered it through a couple of the food delivery services. Writing this review is making me hungry for some duck fat wings!

kZHzQ_l-l2rbKKrOAcMZ-Q.text: One of my go to spots in Phoenix! The vibe, food and staff are fantastic! The steamed buns are by far my favorite! But pretty much everything here is worth getting!

TbAjPj9e6LNArONZQZByiQ.text: Love love love their food and drinks!!!! We had almost all dishes and quite a few drinks on the menu at this restaurant. :) The service is excellent too, our favorite waitress is Decker. :)) They have a very good deal on Tuesdays on food and drinks. Really like their ramen, rice, and noodle dishes. all the dishes are packed with flavor. A must try drinks if you like gin are French 75, Bees Knees, & Thai basil gimlet. One of our favorite places to eat at in Phoenix!

photos.caption: Photo of Clever Koi - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shaking Beef- great!

cI6Z06wJz_iJuIwVlAiieg.text: The atmosphere is so zen and calming. It was like a cute little oasis in the middle of Arizona.   My friend and I started with the steamed buns. I had the soft shell crab and she had the pork belly. Those were delicious and I wish I had made them my meal and ordered more.   We also shared the tuna chips which I highly recommend!   For dinner I chose the Pad Thai. Normally I love this dish when I order it at restaurants but unfortunately that was my least favorite part of the meal.  I'd suggest getting some apps to share and the tuna chips here.

3Zg71K_LhSAElSoB_3GcvQ.text: Food was awesome! We checked in and got the free dumpling which is like a broken down version of your traditional dumpling and all of the flavors were beautiful. I had the Arizona ramen and my boyfriend had one of the Curry's which had a bunch of layers of texture and it was pretty spicy which we loved. All in all, you're paying for a quality Asian fusion meal with great ambience and big portion sizes. Would definitely recommend!

jxJEI_q5FTIiR2Hjv845RQ.text: After living like 10 feet away for six months, my fiance and I finally made time to try Clevor Koi, and I'm so glad we did!  We went around 7p on a Friday night, and though it was very crowded, we were seated right away. I loved that it felt private and not too loud, but was also full of people. It was a really fun atmosphere. It was also cool to be able to see the chefs working in the kitchen, I always think that's fun. Our servers were awesome as well; our plates were always cleared super fast, and we never had a chance to finish our water before they brought more!  For an appetizer, we ordered the Confit Wings (#1). These were delicious! You could taste the duck fat, which I haven't had before, but I thought it was really good, and I loved the siracha sauce. For dinner my fiance ordered the Spicy Seafood Hot Pot, which he really liked, but thought was hard to eat lol. Neither of us know what we're doing with chopsticks. I got the House Pad Thai with tofu, and that was really good as well!   If I'm being honest, while we thought the food was really good, we didn't love it, but that's just because we haven't had a ton of authentic Asian food (even though they say they're Asian-inspired I felt like it was really authentic), so maybe it's just not our thing!   Overall, I'd definitely recommend this place to anyone who is looking for a fun dinner! It's on the expensive side I think, but I loooved the restaurant itself, and do want to go back to try more of the menu options. I need to try the cocktails, too!  :)

LAR04D64xO3cW3OhPvhftA.text: Some of the best Ramen I've ever had and I'm from NYC. Great vibe, really cool ambience. Spectacular and delicious food. Will definitely be going back soon.

FGmVKwkypBozx8nmTpB-Ig.text: Very delicious little Ramen shop in central Phoenix. The service was good, the food was better than average, my favorite thing was the pork dumplings. I had the lemon pepper chicken Ramen and my friend had the pork Ramen both were delicious, I liked the pork a little better. We also have the steamed buns which were very good, the chicken and waffle one was very Americanized -  I would get the other choices. But overall very good I would definitely go back!!

COvxSUs-pTYfkyMXvzW1ww.text: Presentation is EVERYTHING at Clever Koi! The overall energy and vibes at this place make it one of my favorite local restaurants/bars for amazing craft cocktails and delicious ramen. I absolutely recommend asking for Tommy or Ryan at the bar! Not only can they craft you something better than great, but they make everything so aesthetically pleasing too! I recommend coming here any day of the week!

2DaI38REihNc_A4rC2djfA.text: Probably the most unique menu in town with a drink list that is unrivaled. Great date place but a little pricey to be a regular haunt. Recommend coming for happy hour and trying the appetizers.

j11aOH-BaaZhtswb-eTzUA.text: Had a great experience here for Valentines Day. Cool ambiance with open kitchen seating, service was exceptional, and the food was delicious. Definitely will be going back, and no question starting with the dumplings again!

xYU9CAcj4Z-H1Imj7v2b0w.text: Fabulous dinner Saturday night for my birthday with my family.  It started with making the reservations and the staff was super accommodating.  Front gals were super friendly, they knew it was my birthday (maybe my tiara gave it away!) and there was a special table arranged for us.  Our server, Mary was spot on w/ service, recommendations and made sure we had a fabulous experience. THE FOOD WAS AMAZING - Tuna Chips, Steamed Buns ( soft shell crab, pork and chicken & waffles), Pork Ramen, Dan Dan Noodles & House Pad Thai w/ Tofu & Shrimp were some of the highlights. We ALL can't wait to go back for more!

pS5PFD_7P0Q08dpelc9f8g.text: I have had a great experience every single time I dine at the Koi. The wait staff always has great suggestions and I am pleased every time. The parking lot is sufficient. The ambience is very nice especially on a date night. I recommend to anyone looking for a change up on their regular dining palate.

ZoD3_qwm1w8pvkvpqoWBBw.text: Love this place! The Baun tacos are sooooo good I always get all of them! Definitely worth checking out.

nRLYFHUGbpmrfkpCMhTRJA.text: Clever Koi has a great atmosphere and awesome back patio. If you want a restaurant that is hip, fun and makes you feel like you live in a big city, this place is for you. The ramen bowls are so good but are massive so I recommend splitting one. They are so good. The fried rice was just okay. But other than that, I will definitely be back!

NeWwCcloD6SEEZ4yjGczdA.text: Found this under unique finds and 110% satisfied. From the drinks to the steam buns and dumplings to the main course of pork ramen and pineapple duck was absolutely delicious! Raymond, our waiter helped us navigate the menu and everything we had was AMAZING! Kudos to the chef!

-8ENe8Z0eCDiorLX8SteCw.text: This was our (my husband and I) first time here and it won't be the last! It was very delicious and our server was awesome! The pork belly, the soft shell crab and chicken an waffle steamed buns were great. My hubby said the Pork belly one was the best. The Lemon chicken Ramen was bomb.com and super filling that I ordered and my husband said the duck curry was really good even tho it was spicy! Definitely, we will be back. They have vegan dishes I want to try!!

MbokSC47a1zu1Fk7kHnZ0g.text: WOW!!! First time there tonight. Incredibly complex, layered, complimentary flavors. Sampled selections of 5 items, such as tuna chips, steamed buns and banana fritters with a great dipping sauce. Manager Christina and servers Mike, Brian and Megan were wonderfully professional as was all others we came in contact with. Vodka martinis to die for (Monopolowa)! I will go back and send people. Thank you!!!

gBKeYaNJD6uIhjWbNhLJBA.text: I was excited to try this place out but unfortunately it was very underwhelming. The atmosphere was nice for a date however the food was mediocre and over priced.   Tip: Don't go out of your way to make it during happy hour. It's about a one dollar difference.

UO--7TxB2PucxVA40mv4tA.text: Oh yesssss.  After having book marked this place for a while, I finally got a chance to eat here.  Nice and clean. Staff is exceptionally friendly. Food is very worth the hundreds of positive reviews. Lunch specials are great!  What really made the experience top notch is the attentiveness of the people who own/work here.  I ordered the ramen with pork belly, which was delicious! I don't know what sorcery they use but the pork belly was crispy and succulent.   But I am trying to watch what I eat, so instead of devouring the pork belly (like I would have normally done), I took it apart and only ate the leaner portions. When one of the guys noticed the scraps, he asked if I wanted more leaner pieces. Now. That's what I call great service and attention to their patrons needs.   Check it out! I can't wait till my next visit!

GLHm7SZYcxQqEKHsMHpiUA.text: Clever Koi is a great place to eat.   They have sandwiches, burgers, salads and the best French fries around!   If you're looking for something different check them out!

j9aNHGM4vYGRFIJ-1pp1eg.text: Seriously one of the best Asian fusion restaurants in town! Please try their kimchi fried rice with shrimp or duck. They make all of their food with fresh ingredients and care. You can tell they work hard to have beautiful presentations of their food. Their hot pot is phenomenal and I love love their season salads always

AP1DyAs7S8NSvOCO8zSteA.text: Had difficulty finding this place, parking was a challenge but the food was worth the trip across town. They had a fantastic custom blend of drinks and I became a fan. I sat a the bar and asked for help with selections and they were fantastic

Rk1tcZzdBvpCQl6jpbvqDQ.text: Terrible service, we waited over an hour with no follow up or as much as an apology; very standoffish host. I used to visit this place 2 - 3 times a month, never again.

IC9DS2rPR8f3hSuv7BIN7A.text: Visiting town, looking for some Asian comfort food. Great atmosphere, great food. Super nice people even if the service is a tad bit slow. Great if your not in a rush, good if you are.

k_DHCnjC7ka9vITgPHEW-w.text: Been wanting to try this place for sometime. I came on a Friday night and they were busy. Decided to come back Sunday and got a seat at the bar. The bartender who was really handsome I must say gave me some options. He let me know about the featured wine and app. Sadly I'm not a fan of quail so I just tried the wine to start. I ordered a Riesling which was delicious. For entree I had the "lemon pepper chick ramen". So great! I tried to finish it. I wanted to drink the broth, it was so good. The chicken was crispy. And you could taste a little bit of everything in the ramen. I will definitely be back here with friends for a night out.

7nvvEJhCyu6NKc23-0h9Zg.text: The steamed buns were delicious and the drinks are probably some of the best and most creative you will find in Phoenix. The pho is ok but definitely not the best I have had in Phoenix.

8QUfXt2OsoZ8sdKSxEk4YQ.text: DELICIOUS! WONDERFUL SERVICE! BEAUTIFUL atmosphere! Dinner and cocktails with my neighbor/friend. The food-EXCELLENT! We had the calamari app-OMG!!! I had filet of sole curry on a bed of brown rice with Mexican squash...YASS! Seemed robust and busy initially-we had a reservation, but it was quite nice.  Can be romantic spot, there is also the patio.  I LOVED the service, TOO!  My dish had a few substitutions and the waitress was right on it.  Drinks were DELICIOUS as well. I LOVE this place! New twist on Asian food, check.

9Azd26lp0Iajmtz3Lofxpw.text: Wowwwwww! What a fabulous establishment! The food, wine, cocktails, service, snd atmosphere were TEN!!!! Out of 10!!!!! Bravo Clever Koi!!!!!!!!!

5mBDqcZNhlpZevtDrgP3gA.text: What a super funky place. Fusion food is tough to do right and Clever Koi knows what they're doing! Everything we had on the shared plates menu was stellar, easy to share, and perfectly portioned for our group of 4 ladies. The fried chicken and maple syrup buns were a favorite, as well as the ramen and other noodle dishes. Between the four of us we shared about 5 plates and ended up leaving some food behind as we were too stuffed to go on.  Cocktails were also fabulous! I was so glad to see sipping vinegars (aka shrubs) on the menu. Opting out of cocktails for one round, I just asked if I could have a shrub and soda. One of the absolute best shrubs I've ever had was their cucumber shrub. Wowza! A little of it topped off with soda water and a cucumber slice and I was in heaven. I could drink this every single day for the rest of my life! It was sweet, refreshing, and had just a kick of that sour vinegar flavor that's oh so yummy. A follow up drink was a ginger shrub and soda and it was lovely as well. Definitely something everyone visiting this restaurant should try.  So with great food, great drinks, and great company - our trip was just what I needed after a long flight to Phoenix. Topping off the experience there was fantastic service and an incredible hip, sexy, welcoming atmosphere.   The restaurant has a bit of a fishbowl feel as the walls are all windows, but it makes for an extremely trendy, extremely beautiful evening. Great spot for ladies night, date night, or to impress coworkers. This was so unexpected for me and not what I envisioned as a place that would exist in Phoenix. This city is so cool and I'm so glad to have been able to visit and come to a spot like this to make my trip perfect.

Np-2QSSZvpXQyshjtp3Sfg.text: This place is a real treat. The Chicken Ramen is life-changing and the drinks are incredibly unique. Mixology is a real thing and the bartenders here no how to make a drink.

1WQb7n5ywWg0Tv6659n5IA.text: The Clever Koi is cute and feels very trendy. They have a full bar so this would be a nice dinner or date spot. They usually have some upbeat music playing loudly to help drown out the sounds of the open kitchen.The bar is decently priced for the area, however, this is a very expensive lunch venue now. I do not recommend it for lunch time. That aside they have a great ramen broth and excellent pork buns. They recently got rid of their lunch "Build Your Own" option and so now the same order costs $6-11 more than it used to making a lunch cost about $20-25 on average. The rest of their menu is interesting and their take of Asian fare is usually good but lacks a certain zest. The menu items are quite varied with a decent flavor, but nothing really unique you can't find elsewhere. They have a posted menu on Google, but all the prices are half of what they actually charge so be careful in your planning.

UUzU31MTGdvR8apdjXyDfg.text: Clever Koi is nestled in a charming little nook along Central and right next door to a wine bar and a hair salon.   Atmosphere:   This is a perfect date night spot or night out with friends. It's intimate and charming inside with low lighting and a warmth coming from the kitchen. You can either choose to sit inside or outside and if you sit inside, you can watch them hustle and bustle behind the counter.   Food/Drink   I didn't have a cocktail there the night I went, but I was impressed with the extension cocktail list and will definitely be back to give it a try. The food theme here is a lot about sharing which is what we did.   We started with a couple appetizers, and the one that stood out the most were the Edamame Fritters which were delicious! Imagine Edamame fried into a ball with a sweet sauce to dip. For our main meal, we decided to try several different dishes including the Massaman Curry, Chow Mein, Fried Rice and a couple other items. My favorite item by far was the Curry and when I come back, I will just order that and possibly ask for extra chicken. It had the perfect flavor to it and was creamy and delicious!   I really like this restaurant and especially the atmosphere and warmth. It's a nice addition to the growing Downtown area and I hope they put more businesses like this in the area.

epwL1GRr4lYWgy_6mkrNEw.text: Wish I could give them an extra star. Nick, Owner, went ABOVE AND BEYOND to make our first experience a home run.  Fabulous food, great drink menu and exotic dinner specials. Best restaurant in Phoenix in my opinion.  Thanks Nick, we will be back!

hcXJaK8SVjMwXvopKfQUZw.text: I have to say, it really hurts to give 3 stars because the food here is amazing. But I have been many times and always receive oddly poor service! I use that description because it's strange...the front of house staff is always super nice but also either I always seem to get forgotten or they forget to ring in my drink ...or my food. Every time I have been one of these three things has happened, which is a shame! As a server for many years, service really does make or break a place for me. Unfortunately last night I went straight to the Clever Koi after my workout so I was super hungry. Right when I was thinking our food hadn't been rung in, the bartender walked over and asked me what my order had been and I watched him ring it in. This was almost an hour after ordering! I was trying to give them the benefit of the doubt since it was busy but - damn! Luckily I had good company with my friend and all was well, I just wish he had owned the mistake. I'll definitely be back for the amazing food but I'll also wait awhile until the memory of the friendly but slow service fades.

amKanjNRp5frZmumYeu0OA.text: I ordered from here because Uber Eats launched yesterday and they had a $10 off coupon off your first order (UBEREATS). I got the Green Tea Soba Noodles with duck, bok choy, kimchi and egg. It was a cold dish and so delicious. Everything was seasoned so well and was of great quality. It was also a filling portion.

N37l3Xc-itIcttZqbVoC7A.text: I really really like this place. The food is absolutely unique and well-crafted. The staff are some of the nicest people you'll ever meet and offer helpful suggestions and have great knowledge of the menu. I got the pig face dumplings and crafted my own Udon noodle bowl with pork broth mushrooms bok choy and bean sprouts and it was absolutely fantastic. The ambience is really cool and modern with an ultrachic vibe that I love.
